1.content:
For as long as you can remember, you've been an orphan on the streets of Westeros after your parents died of a plague, or so the wizened old septas who ran the orphanage told you. Small for your age, shy, quiet, and scrawny, you were picked on by other orphaned children growing up, and have sorely regretted the lack of a mother to protect and comfort you. After you grew into adolescence, you were finally able to leave the stifling orphanage and decided to go wherever the wind beckoned, doing odd jobs for farmers, merchants, the occasional lord, and anyone else who could use an extra hand.

During your travels you glimpsed many children far luckier than you. While some were born to poor parents, and others to those of more comfortable, if not luxurious means, you considered them all far more fortunate than yourself because they all could look forward to their mother's loving caress, even under the worst of circumstances. In contrast, all you ever received from any woman was a polite thank you for services rendered, if not apathetic indifference to your very existence. This was especially apparent on the exceedingly rare occasions when you encountered a woman from the nobility. Stunningly beautiful yet so often cold and arrogant, they barely seemed to look at "the help," especially someone as meek and awkward around women as yourself. Your only escape from this lonely, itinerant lifestyle was at night, when you collapsed exhausted under a tree, or, if you were lucky, in a farmer's barn or the floor of an inn.

Many a night as you slept under the stars, you sought refuge in dreams about the kind of mother you desperately wished you could have. Large, full breasts were, of course, mandatory, as were a tall height, full lips, smooth, soft skin, a slim waist, wide, child bearing hips, toned thighs, a generous butt, and dainty, well formed hands and feet, though other features changed each night. Sometimes, she was a blonde with fine hair that glittered like beaten gold, and blue eyes that shimmered with motherly love, like a placid morning lake, kissed by the earliest rays of the dawn. Other times, however, she was a brunette a red head, or had jet black hair, thick, and luxuriant, accompanied by brown or green eyes that twinkled mischievously like the gems you often saw being sold by street peddlers.

Her personality changed as well, night after night. Some things were constant, of course; she was generally doting and affectionate, cooing as she cuddled with you, stroking your hair, whispering in your ear, smothering you with kisses, and (though you were embarrassed to admit this, even to yourself) unashamedly servicing your hardened member as you greedily suckled at her breasts. Sometimes, she'd give you a bath, soaping you up in a tub of warm water, thoroughly scrubbing your ticklish armpits, feet, and knees as you giggled, while she paid special attention to your genitals and butthole. Occasionally, you would misbehave, not truly of course, but just to see how she would react. In some dreams, she would react with mock annoyance, subjecting you to a merciless tickling session, playfully counting your ribs with her long, painted nails, licking your soles, nibbling your toes, or blowing raspberries on your bellybutton. In others, however, (and this was even more embarrassing) she would respond with a sultry smirk, pulling you over her firm thighs, trapping your member between them, and subjecting your defenseless buns to some delightfully naughty spanking with her soft, delicate palms, as she "accidentally" fondled your genitals, buttcrack, and butthole with her nimble fingers - for your own good, of course.

Alas, even the grandest dream must yield before the grim intrusion of the real world, and today was no different. Your latest nocturnal reverie ended with a jolt, as an irritated innkeeper kicked you awake. He had allowed you to stay the night after helping fix his roof,but wanted you gone before his customers awoke. Glaring at his ugly mug, you reluctantly stumbled out of the Inn at the Crossroads. As its name suggested, this inn was located in the center of the Riverlands, and therefore most of the other Seven Kingdoms were within a few weeks travel. Glumly rubbing the bruise made by the inkeeper's boot, you wondered which direction to go in search of work.

Should you go North? Ruled by House Stark, and home to several other prominent Houses like the Forresters, Whitehills, and Glenmores, the people of this harsh, cold kingdom could use some to help bringing in the harvest in preparation for winter, or bringing in the daily catch of fish at the port city of White Harbor. Even further north of that is the Wall that separates the Seven Kingdoms from the savage wildling people, and the prospect of going there both terrifies and intrigues you...

Or you could go West to the Westerlands. Ruled by the wealthy House Lannister, the people of this rocky kingdom could use some assistance digging gold out of their many mines. West of the Westerlands lie the Iron Islands, populated by the fierce and piratical Iron born. They might be able to use your help in their iron mines.

Going South would be another option. South of the Riverlands are the kingdoms of the Stormlands, Reach and Dorne, ruled by Houses Baratheon, Tyrell and Martell respectively. The Stormlands is known for its windswept coasts and forests, the Reach for its fertile soil, and Dorne for its sweltering desert climate. You might be able to hunt in the Stormlands' vast forests. In contrast, the Reach could use your help bringing in their bountiful harvest, and the people of Dorne would surely appreciate some help digging wells.

In the East lie the Vale, ruled by House Arryn, and the Crownlands, ruled by the King of Westeros from his capital of King's Landing. The Vale is a cold, hilly kingdom, and yet is known for its agricultural output, and you could probably find work harvesting it. And if all else fails, well, there's always work to be had in the capital, if you aren't choosy about what you're willing to do. Of course, just because you go to the capital doesn't mean you have to stay there. Offshore from King's Landing in the Narrow Sea lies the mysterious island fortress of Dragonstone, the ancient citadel of House Targaryen. Like the far North, Dragonstone too is a mysterious place that few dare venture to. Who knows what you could find if you had the courage to visit?

Then again, why stay in Westeros at all? To the East, across the Narrow Sea lies the continent of Essos, home to the Free Cities, the Dothraki Sea, and gods know what else! You've heard rumors of monsters, sorcerers, and other mysterious things in Essos, though you've never had the chance to go there. Why not travel to Maidenpool, a seaside town in the Riverlands itself, and sign up to work on a merchant ship that'll take you to Essos? Who knows what job opportunities are available there? Then again, it might be safer to stay in Westeros, where things are familiar...
1.title: Introduction

choices: A hundred years before the Targaryens fall (around 183 A.C.)
Shortly before the Targaryens fall (before 283 A.C.)
Shortly after the Targaryens fall (after 284 A.C.)
Shortly before the events of the series (before 298 A.C.)
During the events of the series. (298 A.C.)
11.content:
Although it offers perhaps the most inhospitable environment of all the different regions of Westeros, you are inclined to venture up to the North. It is by far the largest of the Seven Kingdoms, and the old families in Westeros originate from there. Furthermore, since it is likely to be getting cold up there, harvesting and other lines of work are bound to be available in abundance. Also, people will be looking for ways to stay warm, which would include huddling up with others.

On that note, the women in the North are quite remarkable. Some of them even fight alongside the men in war. The mothers up there are said to be the most kind and caring in the realm. That alone intrigues you.

After deciding on your destination, you pack up all of your supplies and load it onto your faithful horse, a destrier named Aerion. Once that is finished, you proceed to mount him, and you go to the crossroads next to the inn.

Before we go any further, there is one thing we should establish: what era does this take place in? Does it take place before/during the events of the books/show? Does it take place before that? When?
11.title: Go North

choices: After Eddard's execution, but before the Red Wedding
115.content:
It has been at least fifteen years since the collapse of the Targaryen dynasty. The Baratheons have occupied the Iron Throne for the past decade and a-half. It matters not to you who rules the Seven Kingdoms; all you want is the comfort of an older woman.

Eddard of House Stark, the Lord Paramount of the North, was King Robert Baratheon's closest friend growing up. Not long ago, the king rode all the way to Winterfell just to ask Lord Eddard to be Hand of the King. He did this after the death of his previous Hand, Lord Jon Arryn, who had been their mentor when they were boys.

Lord Eddard may be absent from his homeland, but that does not mean the hospitality of the North went with him. As such, you turn to northern end of the crossroads and urge Aerion forward. There you begin the long ride to the northern half of the continent.

Right now, we must address how far we are into the canon story line. When is this supposed to take place?
115.title: During the events of the series. (298 A.C.)

1152.content:
Recently, Lord Eddard Stark was executed - some say "murdered" - by the order of King Joffrey Baratheon. Lord Eddard's eldest son, Robb, and his vassals had already been waging a war against the Westerlords, who were sworn to Joffrey due to his Lannister blood. The realm is effectively at war with itself now.

You do not particularly care which side wins. After all, these political matters are none of your concern. Even so, since Robb Stark and most of his bannermen are currently south of the Neck, there are a lot fewer people currently in the North as a result.

That implies that the North may have a lot of opportunities for work. It also implies that many of the women in the North are in need of male companionship. Thus, you have two good reasons for heading up that way. And so you do.

You ride Aerion northward for a couple weeks, never straying too far from the Kingsroad. Before long, you arrive at the swamps of the Neck. It takes you and your horse another week to traverse through them. Once you emerge, you find yourself at Moat Cailin. As of now, you are officially in the North. The sudden decrease in temperature is proof of that.

You have a few choices on where to go from here.

You could make for the Wolfswood in the northwest region. Ironwood trees are in abundance in that part of the North, and there are plenty of families who would give you related opportunities for work. Those include House Glover, House Forrester, House Whitehill, and House Glenmore.

Another option is to go to the Wall. Although the Night's Watch is composed solely of men, you might be able to head north and try to ingratiate yourself with the wildlings. You have no quarrel with the Free Folk; they may be willing to accept one such as you.

The possibilities do not end there. There are plenty of other places in the North you can visit, such as Hornwood, Barrowton, Bear Island, White Harbor... or even Winterfell, the ancestral home of House Stark.

Where do you ultimately choose to go?
1152.title: Robb lives; Ned does not

11521.content:
You have a reasonable amount of experience in many trades, but harvesting ironwood is one of your strongest. Therefore, you figure the Wolfswood would probably yield your most ideal prospects.

It also helps that there are plenty of beautiful women in the Wolfswood, as well. According to what you have heard, anyway. You may be disinterested in politics and nobility, but you make it your business to learn of the whereabouts of the foremost beauties of Westeros. The Wolfswood houses several.

There is Lady Elissa Forrester, the wife of Lord Gregor of Ironrath, and a mother of six. She is from the Crownlands originally. With the exception of her brother Ser Malcolm, her entire family died during Robert's Rebellion.

There is Lady Elaena Glenmore of Rillwater Crossing, the oldest daughter of the current Lord Glenmore. There is talk of a betrothal between her and Lady Elissa's firstborn son, Rodrik. Nothing has been finalized yet, though.

There is Lady Gwyn Whitehill, the only daughter of Lord Ludd of Highpoint. She is not at all like her father and brothers, who are recognized by many for their arrogance and cruelty. You heard she was once involved with Lady Elissa's second son, Asher Forrester. That affair ultimately got him exiled from his house. Apparently, he was now somewhere across the Narrow Sea, making a name for himself.

There is Lady Sybelle Glover of Deepwood Motte. Formerly a member of House Locke, she is now married to Robett Glover, and she has two children by him. While her husband and his elder brother Galbart are fighting in the south, she is managing Deepwood Motte in their absence. A wife can get fairly lonely whilst her husband is away, even with her children for company.

Is there any house you are inclined to favor over the others?
11521.title: The Wolfswood

choices: A few differences from the game
115211.content:
All things considered, you feel as though your best prospects would lie with the Forresters. House Forrester IS the leading proponent and foremost authority in the ironwood trade, after all. Your expertise in that field would definitely benefit them.

More notable than that, however, is the current Lady of House Forrester. Although Lady Elissa has given birth to six children - three of which are older than you - some have said that she still has the figure and complexion of a woman half her age. You have also heard a few men mention that they envy Lord Gregor for having such a lovely wife.

With her husband and eldest son in the south and her second son across the Narrow Sea, Elissa Forrester must be feeling rather lonely at present. As such, you elect to head there. If you are fortunate, she may welcome both your skills and your company.

You ride through Moat Cailin, taking a minute to appreciate the once-great ruins. As soon as you are out of the moat, you direct Aerion a little to the northwest, and you ride for the Wolfswood.

I would like to pause here for a moment. In light of House Forrester's fate in Telltatle's Game of Thrones, it may be ideal to change a few things around so that you do not end up suffering the same fate as the other occupants of Ironrath.

Would you prefer to do things differently or keep them the same?
115211.title: Iron From Ice

1152112.content:
Here is what I propose to change around:

Ludd Whitehill, Torrhen Whitehill, and Gryff Whitehill have already died by this point (it does not really matter how or why. Just assume they perished fairly early on in the War of the Five Kings. Ideally, they could have fallen at the Green Fork or the Whispering Wood.). At any rate, since Gwyn is the only Whitehill left (other than her brother Ebbert, who is at the Citadel, and therefore, cannot inherit anything), she has assumed responsibility as the Lady of Highpoint and head of her family.

Furthermore, unlike her father and brothers, Gwyn is genuinely interested in repairing the hostilities between House Whitehill and House Forrester. She is currently in the process of striving towards that objective. As part of their reparations, Lady Elissa has arranged for both Ethan and Ryon to be fostered at Highpoint as Gwyn's wards. She is taking MUCH better care of them than her father did.

Now that Ludd is dead, House Whitehill no longer holds any resentment towards Asher for his fling with Gwyn. As such, Elissa has already sent her brother Malcolm to Essos to retrieve Asher. They may return much sooner than in canon, and they can come back with Beshka (and maybe Amara, too).

At present, Talia is the only one of Lady Forrester's children who was with her at Ironrath at the start of the game and is still there with her mother right now. However, suppose that when you arrive, Mira is there, too. Do not worry too much about why. Maybe Margaery has given her leave to visit her family or something like that.

Better yet, maybe Margaery happens to be visiting the North just for the pleasure of it, and she is a guest of the Glenmores or the Forresters. This could take place sometime before her wedding to Renly. Sure, she never visited the North in canon. She never even had a reason to visit it (other than House Tyrell's connections with House Glenmore), nor did she ever show any interest in visiting it. Still, we ARE taking liberties here.

How does all this sound?
1152112.title: A few differences from the game

11521121.content:
Excellent. Now, we continue with the story.

You spend another fortnight riding through the North. You manage to adjust to the change in climate fairly quickly. The feeling of loneliness, however, takes a little longer to adapt to.

Despite being the largest of the Seven Kingdoms, you note that the North is surprisingly empty. It may seem that way simply because most of the men are off at war, but even then, the vastness is remarkable. You manage to go whole days without seeing another human being. Most of the ones you DO see are just isolated farmers or small towns. Your interaction with the locals is kept to a minimum.

"I thought I would have no trouble finding work here," you mutter to yourself at one point, "I just hope I'll actually FIND someone who can employ me somehow."

After journeying through the frigid expanse of the North for two weeks, you finally arrive in the Wolfswood. However, by this point in time, you find yourself sneezing quite a bit, and it seems even chillier than usual. You wonder if you might be catching a cold.

If so, you are not really surprised. In hindsight, it may have been ideal to dress more warmly and bring along some gear better-suited for surviving in the North. But that cannot be helped now; you are already here, and you can only make do with what you have.

In spite of your cold, you continue to press on. By the time the Sun has gone down, you reach Ironrath. You knock against the heavy gate, and you wait for someone to answer.

As you do, you find yourself becoming more than a little lightheaded. Your illness seems to be getting worse. You find it increasingly difficult to retain your composure, and you are struggling just to remain atop Aerion.

Are you able to hold on until someone comes to see you?
11521121.title: Change for the Better

choices: Duncan brings Lady Forrester to you
Duncan takes you to Lady Forrester
115211211.content:
Through sheer force of will, you manage to avoid falling off your horse. This is no easy task, given how fatigued and weak you suddenly feel, but you refuse to give in. You will not present yourself as a beggar collapsing on a noble's doorstep.

Just then, the gate to Ironrath is opened. You encounter a middle-aged bearded man with a relatively amiable appearance.

"Good day to you, ser," you greet him politely. There is not really much day left, as it is past sunset.

"Good evening, lad," the bearded man returns with a smile and a nod, "What might you be doing here at this hour?"

You sneeze twice, wipe your nose, and tell him "I am a mere commoner looking for work. I came to the Wolfswood because I have great experience with the harvesting of ironwood. Would you happen to know if Lady Forrester is looking for one such as I?"

"Not to my knowledge," the bearded man admits, "But it is possible she may be able to hire you in some capacity. Come on inside."

He steps aside to clear your path, and you swiftly enter the courtyard of Ironrath, still atop Aerion. It is a little easier to concentrate now, but you are hoping you'll be able to lie down soon. Your cold is starting to become a nuisance in many ways.

As he closes the gate behind you, the bearded man remarks "I do not believe you told me your name."

"It is Brynden, milord," you inform him straightforwardly.

The bearded man nods his head and declares "I am Duncan Tuttle, the castellan of Ironrath."

"I will remember that," you declare. After a pause, you gaze down at Duncan and ask "When might I be able to speak with Lady Elissa?"

"Immediately," Duncan Tuttle replies, "At the moment, she is with her daughters in the Great Keep, but so she can spare a minute or two to speak with you."

"I appreciate that," you tell him, "Should I wait here? Or are we going there?"
115211211.title: Don't Give Up

choices: Lady Elissa discusses the possibility of you working for her
Lady Elissa is more concerned about your cold
1152112112.content:
"It would be best if we went indoors," Duncan Tuttle announces, "I would rather not force Lady Elissa to come outside at this hour, especially in this weather. Furthermore... you sound as though the climate does not agree with you."

"In truth, ser, it does not," you admit, sniffing loudly. It must be obvious to anyone nearby that you are congested. Your voice is a little hoarse, too.

"Better get you inside, lad," Duncan remarks. You certainly have no objections.

After turning Aerion over to the stableboys and grabbing your supply packs, you follow the bearded castellan into the Great Keep of Ironrath. Honestly, it is not very big or all that great, but it still looks much nicer and far more accommodating than any other building you've ever been inside of.

Duncan Tuttle leads you to the main hall, where Lady Elissa Forrester is sitting in a chair in front of a fireplace, knitting. Two girls are seated in chairs beside her. One appears older than you; the other younger. You assume they are her daughters Mira and Talia respectively. They may have been talking before you showed up, but when you and Duncan enter, they fall silent.

Duncan has you remain at the entrance of the room. Then he approaches the three ladies, bows his head to them, and states "Please forgive this interruption, my ladies."

"It is no bother, Duncan," Lady Elissa assures the castellan, "I'm certain you have a good reason for it."

The castellan nods his head and gestures for you to come forward. You slowly walk over to him, and you bow to the three females of House Forrester.

Lady Elissa Forrester is definitely in her forties. Even so, her beauty has not faded with age. Her tanned face and skin are almost totally free of wrinkles, her long light brown hair is braided in an elegant pattern, and her curves are quite obvious, especially around her bosom. The blue and gray dress she is wearing accentuates them nicely.

In terms of apperance, Talia Forrester can almost be regarded as a shrunken version of her mother. She looks almost exactly like Lady Elissa. She has the same face, the same light brown hair braided in the same style, the same lips, the same nose, and even the same dress. The only major difference is that Talia does not have much of a chest. Her curves have yet to come in, it seems.

Mira Forrester seems to take after her father more. Although her hair is braided the same as her mother and sister, it is a shade of dark brown instead. Her skin is a little paler, her lips are more supple, and her forehead is a little larger. You have heard she is working as a handmaiden for Lady Margaery of House Tyrell. As to why she is here now... maybe she is on leave.

A beautiful woman and two beautiful girls are gathered in front of you. This makes being ill worth it.

"This young man claims to be well-acquainted with the ironwood industry," Duncan tells his lady and her daughters, "He is here to inquire about the possibility of employment with you."

You smile softly, and you open your mouth to confirm what Duncan has said. However, all of a sudden, you feel an itch in your nose. You quickly turn away and place your left bicep over the lower half of your face. You sneeze into your arm multiple times in rapid succession.

Once you finally stop, you sniff again, turn back to the Forrester ladies, and tell them in a slightly raspy voice "I beg you to excuse me for that. I seem to have misjudged the climate of this country. Even so, what your castellen has told you is true, milady. I am invested in the ironwood trade. I would be most honored if you would consider allowing me to work for you. If you wish, I could provide a list of my qualifications."

What happens now?
1152112112.title: Duncan takes you to Lady Forrester

choices: They prepare a bath for you
They get you out of your snow-covered clothes
11521121122.content:
What Lady Elissa does next surprises you. She sets her knitting down on a small table beside her chair, and then she stands up and walks over to you. She looks you in the eye and says "We can talk about your qualifications later. For now, Brynden, you must get off your feet."

You are confused. "Why do you say that, milady?"

"You are not well," Lady Elissa points out. She then turns to her castellan and orders him "Duncan, fetch the maester. Tell him to meet me in my bedchamber."

The bearded man seems surprised. "Is that necessary, my lady?

Lady Elissa glares at him incredulously. "Can you not see that he is sick? He should not be negotiating for a job. He should be resting."

"Very well, my lady," the castellen firmly declares, bowing and exiting the room.

Once he is gone, the Lady of Ironrath turns to her daughters and tells them "Mira, Talia, please help me with our guest."

"Yes, Mother," the two Northern girls reply in unison, standing up. The two of them go to your sides and each one gives you a helping hand. You are thankful for their assistance; by now, you are so exhausted, that you feel you may collapse at any moment.

The three Forrester ladies then escort you to the bedchamber of the Lady of Ironrath. When you get there, you wonder why they brought you there of all places. The maester's office or a vacant guest room may have been more practical.

Then again, they probably have their reasons. At least they seem genuinely concerned for your well-being.

What do the ladies do now?
11521121122.title: Motherly Instincts Take Over

115211211222.content:
"Let's get you out of those clothes," Lady Elissa proposes.

You are stunned. You turn to her and mutter "I may have misheard you, milady. Did you just... ask me to strip?"

"No, I said that we are going to undress you," she corrects you. There may be a difference, but the result is fundamentally the same. At any rate, Lady Elissa and her girls begin to remove your attire, starting with your leather armor. Once the breastplate is off, Elissa says "It has been snowing since dawn. If you have been riding all day, you've gathered quite a bit of it. Even your armor is soaked. It will do you no good to stay in your cold and damp attire. You will only get more ill for as long as you do not change out of it."

You cannot really argue with that. It would be better to take off these wet, dirty, and uncomfortable clothes. By now, Mira has already removed your gauntlets, and Talia has already removed your greaves. Their lady mother proceeds to unfasten and pull off your doublet. Now you are in your boots, tunic, and breeches. Somehow, those have gotten soaked, as well. Were you really in the snow for THAT long?

The Forrester ladies do not stop there. They swiftly strip off your boots, tunic, and breeches. Now you are in just your smallclothes. You are uncertain about being this naked in front of them. However, it turns out they plan to go even further.

"Settle down on the bed," Lady Elissa instructs you, gently moving you towards it. Once you are laying on the warm sheets, Lady Elissa moves to take off your smallclothes.

This is where you finally protest. You declare "Milady, I am very thankful for your concern, but I do not believe it would be appropriate of me to appear completely naked in front of you. I am certain your daughters are of a like mind."

You are wrong. Lady Elissa and her girls just chuckle at your anxiety. The Lady of Ironrath then smiles and says "Worry not, Brynden. You will not be nude for very long. I have something for you to wear. Something very thick and soft."

You wonder what she could be talking about. But at least she does not plan to keep you totally naked for long. So, you allow her to take your damp smallclothes off of you. Your crotch is left exposed, and you involuntarily cover yourself down there. Mira and Talia just giggle some more. How could they possibly be alright with this? Moreover, how could their mother think this is acceptable?

While you are reflecting on this, Lady Elissa proceeds to get out the aforementioned article of clothing she had in mind for you. It turns out to be...
115211211222.title: Time to Undress

choices: Yes, they give you a robe
No, you are kept in just your nappies
1152112112222.content:
Lady Elissa walks over to a closet, opens it up, and pulls out a large bag. She brings this bag over to the bed and sits down beside you. She then takes out a large piece of white cloth and begins to fold it in a certain manner.

It quickly dawns on you that she is holding a large cloth diaper. You are taken aback by that realization, and you want to protest. You ask her "Are you suggesting that I wear a nappy, milady?"

"No," Elissa Forrester responds, "I am saying that you WILL wear a nappy. Mira, Talia."

At that, the two daughters of Ironrath each grab one of your arms and legs and holds them down against the bed. Evidently, Lady Elissa will tolerate no resistance or disobedience, much to your dismay. You are going to be diapered, whether you like it or not. There is little you can do to go against her wishes; her girls have your limbs immobilized.

Although you are slightly shorter than the average man, you are not usually weak. Over the course of your life, you exercises regularly to keep your strength up. You have built up quite a bit of muscle as a result.

Normally, you would easily be able to break free of Mira and Talia's grip. Alas, certain other factors have rendered you incapable of that. Namely, there is the fact that you have been on the road for several weeks, and you spent the whole day riding. Thus, you are very tired. There is also the matter of your cold, and the fact that you are still a little chilly. With all that together, you are practically helpless against these two girls and their mother. You could not fight back even if you wanted to.

That's when you wonder... do you REALLY want to? After all, being cared for by three very beautiful highborn ladies might not be so bad. Being diapered may be a small price to pay. Furthermore, to be fair, you DO feel quite weak right now. You barely even have the strength to get up to go to the privy. As such, the diapers might actually be a good idea. It would certainly be better than ruining the bed.

Eventually, you decide to give in. You announce "If you believe this is for the best, milady, I won't argue the point. I'll let you put me in a nappy."

"That's a good lad," Lady Elissa says approvingly. She then takes three more things out of the bag: a jar of powder, a jar of cream, and a container of pins. While Mira and Talia continued to hold you down (in the event that you suddenly change your mind, you assume), their lady mother proceeds to diaper you. She applies a healthy amount of powder and cream to your private area, and she rubs them in thoroughly. Your member threatens to rise a couple times. You use every remaining ounce of strength you have to keep it under control. Once your crotch has been prepared, Lady Elissa slips the cloth diaper under your bottom. She pulls the front up between your legs, brings up the sides, and pins them in place securely. She then inspects your diapered crotch to ensure that it is adequately padded, and that the nappy is on properly. After this, she pats your diaper and tells you "Please understand, Brynden, that I AM doing this for your own good."

"I do understand, milady," you assure her. To be honest, the diaper is surprisingly enjoyable to wear. It envelops you in a strange feeling of security and comfort. It also presses up against your manhood. If someone was to rub against it... just the thought makes your member twitch a bit. Thankfully, the diaper is so thick that it does not give away your excitement.

Mira and Talia release your arms and legs, and they both sneak a few pats at your padded crotch, too. They snicker when you blush in embarrassment.

Just then, there is a knock on the door to the bedchamber. It turns out to be Ortengryn, the maester of Ironrath. Obviously, he is here to tend to you.

Right now, you are in nothing but your new diapers. Do the Forrester ladies give you something to wear over your padding before the maester comes in?
1152112112222.title: A diaper

11521121122222.content:
Instead of offering you something more to wear, the Forrester ladies decide to leave you in just your diapers.

Lady Elissa tells her daughters. "Talia, let the maester in. Mira, help me help Brynden sit up."

The younger girl nods and walks over to the door. At the same time, the older girl helps her mother to raise your upper body up a little on the bed. As you rest your back against the pillows, the maester enters the bedchamber.

He is many years younger than Duncan Tuttle, yet he has an even longer beard than the castellan. He also has the look of a man from the Vale. There is a gentle smile and a caring expression on his face.

"You summoned me, my lady?" the maester says to Elissa, as he follows Talia over to the bed.

"Yes, Maester Ortengryn," the Lady of Ironrath confirms. She places a hand on your shoulder and announces "This boy arrived less than an hour ago. He seems to have fallen ill. I would like you to examine him."

Maester Ortengryn nods his head, continues to smile, and states "As you wish, my lady."

At this moment, Lady Elissa and Mira are seated on either side of you. Mira gets up to make way for the maester, and he takes her place at your right side. He then proceeds to give you a short medical examination.

He measures your pulse, your heartbeat, and your breathing. He also gazes up your nose and uses a very small stick to take a nasal specimen. Then he presses his hand on your forehead to check your body temperature. He handles you very carefully, as though you are made of glass. Because of that, you feel as though you can trust this man.

Thankfully, he does not go so far as to examine your private section. At least you are spared THAT much dignity. Interestingly, he says nothing about your padding. You are certain he has noticed it, but he does not seem bothered by it. It is almost as though he regards it as perfectly normal.

Now that you think about it, it IS a bit odd that they would just happen to have diapers large enough to fit someone your age. That makes you wonder; could someone else at Ironrath wear nappies? Maybe even one of Lady Elissa's children?
11521121122222.title: Only Padding Is Permitted

choices: Lady Elissa sends her daughters to their own bedrooms
Mira and Talia ask to spend the night in their mother's bedroom
115211211222222.content:
You decide not to open your mouth. You can always wait until later to ask if somebody else are Ironrath uses diapers. It would hardly be appropriate to inquire about it so suddenly.

When the maester is finished with his examination, he turns to Lady Elissa and declares "He just has a cold, my lady. It should only last a few days. Until he gets better, though, he should stay off his feet. He'll need plenty of rest, and it is important to keep him warm."

"Understood, maester," Lady Elissa says to acknowledge, nodding her head, "Thank you for your services."

"But of course, my lady," Ortengryn says in response, smiling once more.

The maester then exits the bedchamber, and Lady Elissa and her daughters are the only ones with you once again.

On the one hand, you are happy to be receiving so much care and attention from three beautiful highborn ladies of the North. On the other hand, you are in front of them in nothing but a pair of thick, soft cloth diapers, whereas they are fully-clothed. You have very mixed feelings right now.

A thought occurs to you. You gaze up at Lady Elissa and ask "Where might I be sleeping tonight, milady?"

She gazes at you as though you have said something amusing. She scoffs and mutters "Right here, of course."

You are a little surprised. "Isn't this your bedchamber?"

"That's correct," is all she says in response. "I am not about to leave you by yourself while you are sick. So, at least until you are well, you'll be sleeping here with me."

It is evident she will not allow you to argue this point. So, you decide not to protest. Besides, if it means you'll be spending the night with this lovely woman, it would be foolish to refuse. So, you agree to her terms.

Lady Elissa is pleased by how cooperative you are being. She then announces "Alright, it is about time we all settled down for bed. You, in particular, Brynden."
115211211222222.title: Don't Ask

1152112112222221.content:
"Mira, Talia, please go to your rooms now," Lady Elissa tells her daughters.

"Yes, Mother," the Forrester girls declare obediently.

Both of them then kiss their mother good night. Then they move to the other side of the bed, lean closer to you, and place a light kiss on your cheek. You blush a little at this display of affection, but at the same time, you enjoy it.

"Good night, Brynden," says Mira.

"I hope you get better soon," says Talia.

"Good night," you tell them in response, "And thank you."

Mira and Talia then depart their mother's bedchamber, leaving you alone with Elissa. The Lady of Ironrath then helps you into a more comfortable position on the bed, and she remarks "You just relax, sweetheart. Mummy needs to get ready for bed, as well."

You only nod to show your acknowledgment.

Lady Elissa then walks over to a changing screen on the other side of the room. She disappears behind it for a few minutes. You watch the screen intently, wondering when she'll emerge and what state of dress she will be in.

You get some ideas of that in your mind. A couple of them excite you, and they cause your manhood to stiffen. At one point, you feel your cock press against the front of your diapers. You try to get it under control, as you do not wish to risk giving Lady Elissa the wrong idea.

Eventually, Lady Elissa reappears from around the changing screen. You discover...
1152112112222221.title: Alone with Mummy

choices: Drop the matter and just accept everything
11521121122222212.content:
Your eyes threaten to pop out of their sockets, and your jaw nearly drops to your chest.

Lady Elissa Forrester - the wife of Lord Gregor Forrester, the Lady of Ironrath, and the mother of his six trueborn children - is standing in full view of you without a single article of clothing on. She does not even have stockings or smallclothes on.

In spite of that, you cannot deny that she is absolutely gorgeous. Her arms and chest are toned from adapting to the hostile Northern climate. Her thin waist complements her wide hips. Her womanly curves are utterly flawless. Her skin is free of hair and freckles. There is not a blemish anywhere on her body. Most of all, her breasts are even larger than they appeared to be when she was dressed.

All-in-all, Lady Elissa is a vision of beauty.

To top it all off, the pose and expression she is throwing your way comes off as a little seductive. With a wry grin on her face, Lady Elissa begins to approach the bed, her hips swaying sensually from side-to-side all the while. Before she is even halfway across the room, you feel your manhood straining against your padding.

When Lady Elissa reaches the bed, she climbs in beside you. Then she slowly wraps her arms around your upper body, pulls you close, and holds you tightly to her chest. You find your head pressed between her lovely bosoms.

By now, you are fully erect. It is a good thing Elissa diapered you so tightly and thickly; otherwise your member would have broken free by this point.

While you are amazingly aroused and pleased by this moment, you are also extremely bewildered. You struggle to gaze up at the Lady of Ironrath, and you stammer "Milady... why have you undressed completely?"

You cannot think of a discreet way to ask that question, so you choose to just ask it outright.

"For your sake, of course," Lady Elissa replies, grinning sweetly, "And no more 'milady.' You are to address me as 'Mummy' from now on."

That does nothing to ease your bewilderment. If anything, it only worsens it. "I'm afraid I do not understand... Mummy."

"We will need to keep you warm until you are over your cold," Lady Elissa explains, "Therefore, I will be sharing my body heat with you while you are asleep. I cannot do that if I have a nightgown or another other attire on."

That answers one questions, but leaves many others unanswered.
11521121122222212.title: Nude Noblewoman of the North

115211211222222121.content:
You cannot deny that she has a valid point. Even so, there are other things to consider. You remark "What if you happen to catch my cold?"

"That is not likely," Elissa debates, "I have lived in the North for over twenty years. In all that time, I have never once caught a cold. Not even when my own children had one."

"And is THIS how you helped them get over their illness?" you ask in interest, genuinely curious. Is she that kind of mother?

"Yes," the Lady of Ironrath answers straightforwardly, "I am very close to my sons and daughters, Brynden. Not in the manner of the Targaryens, of course. All the same, I do not believe there should be a limit to how affectionate a mother can be with her children."

"But I am not one of your children," you point out.

"I realize that," Elissa assures you, "However, you are clearly no more a native of the North than I am. Yet you came all the way to the Wolfswood simply to look for work. At such a young age, as well. All that together suggests that your own mother is no longer living. Am I right?"

You are impressed by how observant she is. You just nod your head and admit "You are, milady. Both she and my father have been dead these past ten years. I've been all on my own, travelling across Westeros since then."

"That ends now," Lady Elissa insists firmly, "I know what it is like to lose one's entire family. My brother Malcolm and I were the only ones to survive King Robert's Rebellion. If not for my marriage to Gregor, we might have perished with our parents and siblings. Although I survived, I was saddened by that loss. My husband and children helped me to cope."

You are taken aback. "Then your new family filled the void left behind by your old family?"

"Indeed," says Lady Elissa, giving you another loving hug, "Perhaps I may be able to do the same for you."

How do you react to that?
115211211222222121.title: Inquire Further

1152112112222221212.content:
You are touched by Lady Elissa's empathy and kindness. She is a noblewoman whom you never met until less than two hours ago. Yet now, she is offering to take you in and care for you as though you are her own son.

You never would have thought anyone would ever provide an offer so generous and wonderful. Now that someone has... you are elated.

You return the hug and you mutter softly "If you will have me... I would be honored to stay here with you. I do not know how I could ever thank you, milady."

Lady Elissa is very pleased with your decision. She lightly kisses your forehead, and she tells you "Remember, you are to call me 'Mummy,' dearest. And you do not need to thank me. I should be thanking YOU instead."

"Why is that?" you ask.

She explains: "With Rodrik in the south, Asher across the Narrow Sea, and Ethan and Ryon at Highpoint, you are now the closest thing I have to a son here at Ironrath. You are the very thing I need to fill the absence of my boys."

"Well, I am glad we'll be able to help and support one another... Mummy," you comment.

Elissa just smiles again and kisses you once more. This time, on the lips. It is a brief kiss, but you can feel the passion behind it.

"Do you have any other questions, darling?" she asks you.

"Just one," you tell her. You gaze down at your padded crotch, and you remark "I admit these nappies are nice. However, I notice they are quite big. They do not look as though they were meant for a babe. They look as though they were designed for someone much older."

"In truth, they were," Lady Elissa confesses, "We are fortunate they happen to fit you so well."

Then it is just as you suspected. You look back up at the Lady of Ironrath and assume "So, there IS someone at Ironrath who wears nappies past infancy?"

"That is correct," she confirms.

"For my curiosity's sake, could you tell me who?" you ask. That is one thing you would definitely like to know. After all, someone in House Forrester wears diapers as a growing child or an adult. Who could it possibly be?

Lady Elissa promptly answers with...
1152112112222221212.title: Give In and Embrace Your New Mother

11521121122222212122.content:
"I do."

You expected her to say that her youngest Ryon wore diapers, or that Talia or her twin brother Ethan wore them. You had even considered the possibility that Mira, who is slightly older than you, wore them.

But apparently, none of those are the case. It turns out Lady Elissa herself is the one who wears them. You never would have guessed that, except maybe in one of your fantasies.

"You wear nappies?" you ask, checking to ensure that you have not misheard her.

"Yes," the Lady of Ironrath shamelessly admits, "But not because I need them or anything of the sort,"

"Then why DO you wear them?" you ask curiously.

Lady Elissa smiles and explains: "It started when I was pregnant with my son Rodrik. You see, many expectant women have weaker bladder control. My case in particular was extreme; I lost it almost completely. This happened every time I became pregnant. As a solution, each time I was with the child, the maester recommended that I wear nappies until I gave birth. Only he and my lord husband know of this. And now, you, too."

You are amazed that she would entrust you with such a secret. Her reason for wearing diapers is actually a valid one. However, there are certain details that do not add up.

"How old is your son Ryon?" you inquire.

"He's about to witness his seventh nameday," Elissa replies.

"Are you planning on having any more children?" you ask next.

"Well, there is YOU," Elissa tells you with a wry grin, stroking your cheek and making you blush, "But if you mean children from my own womb, I do not have any such plans."

"Then why do you still have the nappies?" you ask.

"Because I LIKE them," Lady Elissa reveals, much to your surprise. She explains: "By the time I was carrying Mira, I came to discover that I somehow enjoyed wearing nappies. It mostly has to do with the way they press up against my womanhood, as well as how bulky, soothing, and cumbersome they feel. They are comfortable, reassuring, and stimulating all at once."

You cannot really argue with that. Truthfully, your own padding has a similar effect on your manhood.

"I do not wear nappies all the time," Elissa informs you, "Just every once in a while, usually when my husband and I have gone a long time without becoming intimate. You might think of them as a substitute for relieving tension."

That actually makes sense, though you are loath to admit it. You gaze at Lady Elissa's nude figure once more, and not just to admire it this time. You try to imagine how that gorgeous body would look with a thick layer of white cloth wrapped around the loins. You can partly imagine it, and you partly cannot.

While you are staring at Elissa's body, she suddenly asks you very seriously "Would you like to see me in a nappy, Brynden?"
11521121122222212122.title: "I do."

choices: That night, you spot a body floating on the Trident
You make it to the border, but something in the Neck delays you
You reach the North without any troubles
1153.content:
A short time ago, you had heard that a wedding had taken place between Lord Edmure Tully of Riverrun and Roslin Frey, daughter of Lord Walder Frey. It was meant to renew an alliance between Robb Stark, the alleged King of the North, and House Frey. However, just as the wedding was being consummated, the Freys had turned on and murdered King Robb and his loyal bannermen, violating the sacred guest right. You had heard rumors that House Bolton and House Lannister had been complicit in this abominable act.

This deception may have ended the War of the Five Kings, but it had also succeeded in earning House Frey the ire of every respectable house in the Seven Kingdoms. As a native of the Riverlands, you are outraged by this gross misconduct, as well. Just the thought of it infuriates you.

"If the gods are real, they will punish those treacherous weasels for their atrocities," you think aloud, though Aerion is the only one who can hear you.

That is another reason why you wish to leave your homeland. You have no desire to live in a region ruled by House Frey. The idea alone makes you sick.

At any rate, you proceed to ride north. You make good time, and you hardly see another person all day. When night falls, you decide to make camp along the Trident. You should be able to reach the North within a week's time.

What happens now?
1153.title: After the Red Wedding

choices: Take your horse and try to find help.
11531.content:
After having a light dinner and feeding Aerion, you are about to bed down for the night. You would prefer to sleep in a bed indoors, but you cannot afford that luxury, especially since you're so far away from any inns. On the bright side, you have a tent, and the ground along the Trident is a little softer than it typically is elsewhere.

Just before you enter your tent, something catches your eye. Up until now, the surface of the nearby river has been relatively calm and peaceful. At this moment, a large mass comes floating downstream. Although it is quite dark, the shine of the moon reflects on the surface of the water, and you are able to identify it as a body. The body appears to belong to a woman, and she is lying face-up.

You have no idea who that woman might be, but it occurs to you that she might be alive. Even if the chances are slim, you are unwilling to turn a blind eye. Regardless of who she is, you feel compelled to rescue her.

You hastily remove your clothing until you are down to your smallclothes. Then you dive in and swim out to meet the body. When you reach her, you grab on, hold her securely, and bring her back to the shore.

When you are back on the shore, you get a closer look at her face. She appears to be in her mid-thirties, and she has long auburn hair and red lips. Her clothing suggests she is highborn. You check for a pulse and a heartbeat, and you find both. However, upon a closer look, you realize that her throat has been cut. She is bleeding out slowly but surely. You panic at that, and you wonder what you can do for her.
11531.title: Chance to be a Hero

choices: The next morning, she wakes up
The next morning, she is still unconscious
115311.content:
You have no idea how close the nearest house is, let alone the nearest maester. You could always take Aerion and ride out to look for someone, but by the time you managed to find someone, it is very likely that this woman will have died. As such, your only feasible option is to try to treat her yourself.

You examine the wound in her throat a little more closely, and you realize she is not actually cut too deep. You have enough knowledge of treating injuries that you may be able to mend her wound on your own.

You quickly bring the wounded woman to your campfire; Aerion shies away from the scent of blood. After placing her down just a few feet away from the fire, you draw your dagger and hold the blade over the fire. When it is hot enough, you lightly but firmly press it against the cut in the woman's neck, effectively cauterizing the wound.

Once that is done, you are able to stitch her neck up. You figure that the flesh will be able to repair itself on its own within a couple weeks. You can be certain of that because you once received a similar wound in your chest, which you also treated yourself.

When the woman is out of danger, you can breath a sigh of relief. Still, you cannot help but wonder who she is. You can always speculate, but you ultimately decide to just wait until she wakes up, and then ask her.

You bring her into your tent, and then you gently strip off her wet clothes. You only do this because you do not wish her to catch a cold by staying in those wet garments. Even so, you cannot help but stare at her full, rounded breasts when they are revealed to you.

Despite that, you decide to be chivalrous, and you divert your eyes from the woman's bust. After undressing her, you cover her with some spare blankets, and you whisper softly "Good night. I pray you live to see tomorrow."

You allow her to sleep on your bedding. You take the soft ground beside her, and then you fall asleep.
115311.title: Try to treat her yourself

1153111.content:
When the sun rises the next day, you wake up. The woman is still asleep, but she looks as though she is going to awaken at any moment.

You decide to slip out of the tent, get dressed, and make breakfast. You figure that should be the first order of business, as the woman looks as though she has not eaten in at least a few days. Plus, you have no idea what state of mind she will be in when she comes around. You may as well try to get on her good side by providing some services.

By now, the campfire has gone out. You quickly start it up again, and you place a skillet with some eggs and sausages on top of it. While everything cooks, you get dressed. Once you have your underclothes and light armor on, breakfast is finished. You feed Aerion some oats and apples, and then you bring the eggs and sausage inside the tent.

Just as you reenter your sleeping space, the woman stirs. With some difficulty, she manages to open her eyes and sit up a bit. You come to her side and help her into a more comfortable position. "Take it easy, my lady. You shouldn't overexert yourself."

She looks at you in surprise, and she tries to back away. She asks "Where am I? How did I get here?"

"You're in a tent along the Trident," you say, "I found you floating in it last night, and I fished you out."

"Why?" she says suspiciously.

"Because I couldn't very well have left you out there," you reply in a very straightforward tone, "No one deserves to be cast aside like that."

She is surprised by your humility and kindness. A moment later, she presses her hands against the front of her throat, and she feels the cut in it, along with the stitches you put in. She asks "Did you... do this, too?"

"Yes, I did," you reply, "And you may wish to keep on hand on that blanket, my lady. There is nothing else beneath it covering you."

She looks down and realizes that she has no clothes on, and she hastily pulls the blanket over her nearly-exposed breasts. She glares at you and mutters suspiciously "Why am I naked?"

"I needed to check you for additional injuries, and your clothing was too wet to sleep in," you explain, "Worry not; I hung it out last night. It should be dry by now. I'll get it for you after we eat."

"Very well," she says, though she clings to the blanket. You cannot blame her; no woman wants to be exposed in front of strangers, even if they appear friendly.

The woman is too weak to hold anything, so you proceed to feed her yourself. With some difficulty, she manages to swallow about a third of the eggs and sausage. You help yourself to the rest of the food, and then you retrieve her clothing for her. She asks you for help dressing, as she is also too weak to lift her arms very much. Apparently, she has already concluded that she can trust you.

Once she is dressed, you say "Now, I believe I should introduce myself. My name is Brynden. I am a man of many trades."

She remarks "You look a bit young to be a man just yet."

"I suppose," you mutter, "Might I ask your name, my lady?"

She hesitates a moment, and then she reveals "Catelyn Stark."

You are flabbergasted. Sitting before you was the elder sister of Edmure Tully, as well as the wife of the late Lord Eddard Stark and the mother of his children. Including King Robb, who had been murdered at the Twins not three days earlier.

You promptly kneel before her and declare "I offer you my deepest condolences for your losses, my lady. And... I offer you my service, for whatever it is worth. House Frey may be the overlords of the Riverlands now, but I have lived in this region all my life, and I refuse to acknowledge the leadership of anyone other than the Tullys."

She is impressed and touched by that. She grins softly and says "Thank you, my boy. That means more to me than words can convey. But are you certain you wish to do this?"

"Of course," you insist, "I am not about to abandon a lady in her hour of need. Least of all the daughter of the late Hoster Tully."

She smiles, sits up a little bit more, and says "In that case, I have a favor to ask of you."
1153111.title: The next morning, she wakes up

choices: You stop at an abandoned house before you reach the North
You reach the North, and then you look for shelter
11531112.content:
"I would like you to be a substitute for my children," she requests.

You are confused. "I'm afraid I do not quite understand, my lady."

"I have birthed five children," Lady Catelyn tells you, "My two youngest sons were murdered last year. My younger daughter is missing, my elder daughter is a prisoner of the Lannisters, and my eldest son was butchered less than a week past. It would appear that all my children are lost to me now."

You are deeply saddened to hear that. "I cannot even imagine the type of agony you must be in right now, my lady."

"It is devastating," she claims, "It hurts far worse than the throat injury I received just after I saw my boy Robb die. I almost welcomed death, as I felt I had nothing left to live for. However... upon meeting you, I have realized that I do."

"How so?" you ask.

"I can tell you are a good person," Catelyn Stark explains, "You risked your life to save me, and you have already offered yourself to me when I have lost everything. Furthermore, you seem to be about the same age as my Robb. So, I ask that you allow me to care for you as though you were one of my own children."

Most boys your age would probably refuse a request such as that one, or hesitate for a long while. You, on the other hand, are delighted. If you can help Lady Catelyn's pain and indulge your mother fantasies at the same time, the only logical solution is to accept.

"Very well, my lady," you declare, "If it truly helps you, I will play the part of your son."

Lady Catelyn is overjoyed. She leans forward, wraps her arms around you, and pulls you into a hug. You tenderly hug her back, being careful not to squeeze too tightly. She is still recovering from her injuries.

After pulling away, you tell her "We should probably seek some shelter, my lady."

She places a finger on your lips and tells you "Please, call me 'Mummy."

You chuckle, but nod along. "Very well, Mummy. Anyway, I am about to break camp. You can help if you'd like, but please do not strain yourself. Otherwise, your stitches may open up."

"I understand, darling," she tells you.

While you take down the tent and pack up it and the rest of your supplies, Lady Catelyn tends to Aerion. The horse seems to take a liking to her fairly quickly. That is good; if this relationship is going to work, you'll need them to get along.

Once you've gathered all your supplies, Lady Catelyn helps you load it onto Aerion. You then gesture to the saddle and say "You should ride him, my l- Mummy. You are in no condition to walk great distances just yet."

She cannot argue that, but she does say "There seems to be room enough to fit us both, sweetheart. I insist you sit in front of me."

The thought of that thrills you. You proceed to help Lady Catelyn onto Aerion, and then you mount him, as well. When you are in front of her, she wraps her arms securely yet gently around you, and she cuddles you close. The embrace makes you feel warm inside.

Despite this sudden unexpected development, you see no reason why you cannot continue heading north. Lady Catelyn does not seem to mind where you go, as long as you do not leave her. So, you resume heading north.
11531112.title: Becoming a Replacement

115311121.content:
After another day's travels, you spot a house alongside the Kingsroad. There are no lights coming from the windows, nor is there smoke coming from the chimney. The front door is wide open, as well. For all intents and purposes, it seems abandoned.

"Should we investigate, Mummy?" you propose, gazing back at Catelyn Stark.

"Maybe we should," she remarks, "But stay close to me. It could be dangerous."

You are accustomed to danger, but you agree to abide by her wishes. A minute later, you reach the house. As it happens, there is a small stable in the backyard. You secure Aerion in there, and then you and Lady Catelyn go back to the front side of the house and cautiously enter. You keep one hand on the hilt of your sword, prepared to draw it at any moment. Lady Catelyn holds onto your other hand protectively, as though she is ready to help or comfort you for anything.

After a quick sweep of the rooms, you confirm that the house is indeed abandoned. However, it is only empty of people. To your delight and fortune, plenty of provisions were left behind. Fruits, vegetables, grains, preserved meats, fresh water, firewood, and other supplies have been stored there. There is enough food and drink to last for months, perhaps.

You wonder how all these provisions happened to be left behind. It could be possible that the previous tenants had to evacuate fairly quickly.

"We should stay here," Lady Catelyn suggests.

You nod along, saying "I agree. We can stay for a while, at least. As long as no one else comes along and tries to take it from us."

"Should that happen, we'll keep each other safe," she mutters, speaking with such conviction.

Next to the kitchen is the master bedroom. The bed in there is large enough to fit as many as four grown people. That gives you an idea of how you and Lady Catelyn could sleep.

There is only one other room in the house, and that turns out to be...
115311121.title: A Possible New Home

1153111211.content:
The room is a nursery. Like the rest of the house, it looks practically untouched.

There is a changing table on one side of the room, stocked with diapers, pins, and changing materials. On the other side of the room is a crib, which appears to be large enough to hold a grown person. There is also an assortment of toys and other supplies meant for babies.

You are surprised to see all this here. Lady Catelyn, however, seems pleased. She comments "This is perfect."

"What do you mean, Mummy?" you ask in confusion.

She turns to you, smiles, and says "Since I am now your mother, I can raise you from the very beginning. That should mean I use everything that comes with caring for babes."

You are stunned when you realize what she is implying. You assume "You mean... you wish to make use of this nursery?"

"Yes, I want you to be my babe," she confirms, speaking in a tone that would allow no argument or objection.

"Does that include nappies?" you ask, though you can imagine the answer.

"Naturally," she replies simply. She then tugs on your hand and instructs you "Now come on. We should get started right away."

Although you have mixed feelings, you do not wish to shatter Lady Catelyn's hopes. Besides, after everything she has endured, she deserves a chance to relieve motherhood. Besides, it is not as though it is a selfish wish or a harmful one.

You allow Catelyn Stark to lead you over to the changing table. Then she helps you out of your clothes until you are fully naked. You blush and attempt to cover yourself, but she pulls your hand away and says "It is alright. You have seen me naked; now I see you naked. We will be seeing each other naked often from now on."

You realize just how true that is, and you gradually move your hands away. Lady Catelyn helps you onto the changing table. She then grabs a pair of cloth diapers, folds them together, and slides them underneath you. She proceeds to apply some powder and lotion to your groin. The sensation of her hands along your privates is quite stimulating, but you keep from getting hard. Once she is finished, she pulls the padding up between your legs and pins it up on both sides.

She is not finished just yet, though. She proceeds to take out another pair of diapers, fold them up, and slide them under you as well.
