You just smirk and say "Allow me to carry you to bed."

Right now, you are carrying her in your arms the way a groom carries his new bride. Although Asha is eight or nine years your elder (and about as many inches taller, too), you are by no means weak. She notices this and remarks "You're stronger than I thought."

"Growing up on the move, I have to be," you remark. After a pause, you say "Tell me something, Asha. You told you'd like a man who could be both your husband and your babe. Would you also like a man who would treat you as both his wife and HIS babe?"

She grins and tells you "Absolutely, Brynden."

You grin back, kiss her on the cheek, and declare "Then I would be delighted to indulge you."

Right now, the candle is still lit. With Asha still in your arms, you lean down and blow it out. Then you waddle over to the bed and gently place her down. The two of you climb underneath the covers and snuggle together. Both of you are still wearing just your diapers, which you have used (but not for either of the conventional purposes). While it may be a little cold, you manage to keep each other warm with your body heat.

It does not take long for you to fall asleep.
12431212222.title: Go to bed

choices: Just get some rest at Pyke
124312122222.content:
After about a week of sailing, the Black Wind arrives in Lordsport on Pyke.

It drops anchor in the early morning. Just as it does so, you wake up. To be precise, you wake up next to the vessel's captain.

Much like every day for the past week, you awake in nothing but your thick cloth diapers. That is all Lady Asha is clad in, as well.

As this moment, she is still asleep. You lean forward and kiss her gently on the lips. At that, she begins to stir, and she soon opens her eyes. She smiles when she sees you above her. She gradually sits up and stretches, giving you a nice view of her gorgeous figure.

"Good morning, darling," she tells you sweetly.

"Good morning, captain," you say in response. Although you are more intimate with her than anyone in her crew, you still cannot help but be formal when addressing her. She does not seem to mind; it reasserts her authority in her heavily male-dominated society.

Asha reaches down and brushes her hand against the front of your diapers. She announces "Looks like I've a wet nappy to change."

Indeed; your padding is soaked with both urine and... cum. Given all the time you've spent with Asha in bed, you tend to stain your diapers more with the latter than the former.

Asha proceeds to change you. After removing your wet diaper and cleaning your private area, she pins you into a fresh new diaper. You've become accustomed to wearing them outside her cabin. Luckily, no one else has found out about them so far. You plan to keep it that way.

You follow Asha's lead and check her nappy, too. She is mostly dry, except for a spot above womanhood. That was simply the remnant of her own climax from last night.

You help Asha out of her diapers, but you do not put her into a new one. She only wears them in her chambers. Outside, she wears regular smallclothes. You cannot really complain; she is an Ironborn captain and a highborn lady. She has the right to wear whatever she pleases.

You and Asha then get dressed. As you slip your tunic and breeches over your diaper, you look to Asha and ask "Where are we off to now?"

"Pyke," she tells you. You know she means the castle. Still, it must be confusing; having a fortress and an island that go by the same name. "If you want, I could introduce you to my father. Or you could just get some rest while I see to business here."

You think on that. It would be an honor to meet the head of a Great House, but you are not certain how Lord Balon Greyjoy would react to a lowborn boy associating with his independent daughter. It would also be undeniably awkward for you to show up to that meeting in a diaper, even if Asha was the only one who knew that secret.
124312122222.title: The Heart of the Ironborn

choices: A hundred years before the Targaryens fall (around 183 A.C.)
Shortly before the Targaryens fall (before 283 A.C.)
Shortly after the Targaryens fall (after 284 A.C.)
Shortly before the events of the series (before 298 A.C.)
During the events of the series. (298 A.C.)
13.content:
After contemplating your options for a long while, you decide to go east. There is not very much between you and the Narrow Sea. So regardless of your ultimate destination, you will not have to ride for very long.

The Crownlands did not technically exist until a few centuries ago, when Aegon I Targaryen and his sister-wives Visenya and Rhaenys landed their dragons and united all the people south of the Wall. Ever since the days of Aegon the Conqueror, the Seven Kingdoms have been seven in name only. Today, they are actually one.

In addition to the Crownlands, the Vale can be found in that direction, as well. There is also the infamous Targaryen island stronghold of Dragonstone.

After breaking your fast, you climb atop Aerion, your faithful destrier. Then you make your way to the crossroads which adjoin the inn you spent the night in.

Before we go any further, there is one thing we should establish: what era does this take place in? Does it take place before/during the events of the books/show? Does it take place before that? When?
13.title: Go East

132.content:
Aerys Targaryen is the current king of the Seven Kingdoms. You personally only know the man by his moniker, the Mad King. Some of the things you've heard of him are not pleasant at all.

Still, the Mad King has never troubled you personally, so you do not let his true nature concern you.

As you follow the eastern road atop Aerion, you think about where you should go.

If you follow this road all the way to the end, you will enter the Vale and ultimately end up at the Bloody Gate. Once behind the Bloody Gate, your safety is all but guaranteed, and you could find work and shelter at the Eyrie, the ancestral home of House Arryn. However, first you need to venture through miles of dangerous terrain. The area between the crossroads and the Bloody Gate is crawling with many clans of wild men and unsavory beasts such as shadowcats. Furthermore, you have no way of knowing if the Knight of the Bloody Gate will allow you entrance. You would definitely be taking a gamble if you choose that path. On the other hand, Lord Jon Arryn, the current Lord Paramount of the Vale and Warden of the East, is known to be an accommodating and hospitable person. That gives you some degree of hope.

Another option is to only follow the eastern road until you reach the border between the Riverlands and the Vale. Once there, you can turn southeast, towards the Crownlands. From there, you have options aplenty.

Your two most promising prospects would be Dragonstone or King's Landing. The island stronghold where privacy is guaranteed, and the capital city, where work is in abundance. On a side note, Queen Rhaella Targaryen is located at the former, and her daughter-by-law, Princess Elia Martell, is located at the latter.

With all that in mind, what will be your destination?
132.title: Shortly before the Targaryens fall (before 283 ...

choices: At least five years before the Rebellion (278 A.C. or earlier)
The Year of False Spring (281 A.C.)
Just before the Sack of King's Landing (late 283 A.C.)
1323.content:
You have always wanted to see the capital city. Of course, you have already SEEN it several times before, but all of those were only when you were passing through the Crownlands. Now would be as good a time as any to actually enter the city. After all, people from every walk of life work and reside there. That means your prospects for both employment and motherly care are more numerous, more diverse, and arguably more promising than almost anywhere else in the Seven Kingdoms.

Anyway, you travel along the eastern road for a couple days. Soon, you arrive at the edge of the Riverlands. Then you converge on the Kingsroad, which breaks off to the south. You direct Aerion down that path. Within a week, you come to the outskirts of King's Landing. As you feast your eyes on the capital city, you smile in anticipation of what you might find within.

By the way, we have already established that Aerys is the one who sits the Iron Throne now. However, at what point in his reign is this supposed to take place?
1323.title: King's Landing

choices: Ride up to the Red Keep
13233.content:
As you near King's Landing, you notice the city's defenses seem to be tighter than usual. That does not really surprise you, given parts of Westeros' recent history.

For the last year, the Seven Kingdoms have been at war. From what you've heard, it began when Prince Rhaegar Targaryen abducted Lady Lyanna Stark of Winterfell. Her elder brother, Brandon Stark, then made a rash and daring attempt to rescue her by riding to King's Landing and demanding Rhaegar's head. That act of recklessness ultimately resulted in the deaths of Brandon, his father Lord Rickard Stark, and all his companions and their fathers. All those deaths were ordered by the Mad King.

That in turn led to Eddard Stark and his allies rising up against the Targaryens. Lord Robert Baratheon of the Stormlands is the leader of that faction. For that reason, the war is now known as Robert's Rebellion. The rebels consist of the North, the Riverlands, the Vale, and almost the whole of the Stormlands. The loyalists consist of the Crownlands and the Reach. Until recently, Dorne, the Iron Islands, and the Westerlands have been neutral. Not too long ago, however, the Iron Islands and the Westerlands decided to declare for Robert, too. That was only after Robert killed Prince Rhaegar at the Battle of the Trident. Since the rebels' victory was all but guaranteed by then, the Ironborn and the Westerlords chose to align with him. Cautious, but cowardly.

Of course, you do not feel you have any place to judge them. They are nobles; you are a commoner. Furthermore, you personally have gone out of your way to avoid getting involved in the fighting or the political disputes so far. Because of that, you have gotten through the whole Rebellion without a scratch.

When you reach the gates, you are relieved to discover that despite the heightened security, they are still allowing the smallfolk entrance.

Once you are inside King's Landing, you wonder where you should go.
13233.title: Close to the Targaryens' Fall

choices: Take safety in a whorehouse or someplace similar
Still try to get into the Red Keep
132331.content:
Since you are in the capital, you may as well visit the Red Keep. There is no guarantee you would be able to get inside, but you could at least try.

You proceed to ride up to the Red Keep. On your way there, you notice that the streets are surprisingly bare. You encounter maybe a score of people. You wonder why that is. It cannot be due to a curfew; it is barely afternoon. It could not be because the city was evacuated; otherwise, the guards would not still be posted on the walls. It could not be because King Aerys ordered the streets cleared; if that was the case, EVERYONE would be inside. No one would dare to disobey an order of the Mad King's, after all.

You decide not to trouble yourself with the lack of activity in the city. You simply continue onward towards the Red Keep.

When you get to the top of Aegon's High Hill, you hear what sounds like shouting. It sounds faint and far-off, almost as though it is coming from outside the city. You peer over your shoulder towards the source of the commotion, and you see thousands of men in the distance.

You turn Aerion around and squint your eyes to get a better look. Soon, you realize those men are part of an army, and not just any army. Even from this distance, you recognize the crimson banners of House Lannister. They are marching this way!

At first, you think they will lay siege to King's Landing. Then it occurs to you; Aerys might not know that the Lannisters have sided with the rebels. He may think they are coming to reinforce him. If so, a siege won't be necessary. They'll be able to enter the city without difficulty. Once that happens... it would be open season on the city's inhabitants.

You feel as though you could not have picked a worse time to enter King's Landing. Although you have been neutral in the fighting so far, you know the Lannister soldiers would not care about that. You are not about to take up arms against them, and by the time you reached one of the gates, they would likely be pouring in from all sides. Your only option is to take shelter.

But where will you go?
132331.title: Calling on the Castle

1323312.content:
You feel it would take too long to find a hideout in the city. Well, YOU could probably find a hideout. You are short enough to fit almost anywhere. Aerion is a different matter, however. You are not going to abandon your horse; the risk that he would be captured or killed by the Lannister soldiers is far too great. With that in mind, the only places you could go are the whorehouses, and as infamous as the King's Landing brothels may be, you cannot see them allowing an actual animal inside. Actually, there might be some who would, but the likelihood is almost negligible.

You decide your only choice is the Red Keep. You are already upon the grand building, anyway. You pass through the gate. To your good fortune, the guards do not even try to stop you for frisking or questioning. You suppose they must have greater concerns than the whereabouts of a commoner and his horse. If so... entering the Red Keep should be no problem.

Sure enough, you and Aerion get inside without much hassle. You are safe for the moment, but that could change. If you want to ensure the continuation of your survival, you will have to act fast.

You get two ideas of what you can do.

First, you could head to the throne room and try to slay King Aerys Targaryen yourself. He may not have that many guards with him, and if he is as mad as people claim, he would be mentally incapable of opposing you. If you ended the Mad King's life, the Lannisters might hail you as a hero.

Second, you could head to the Maidenvault. Princess Elia Martell and her son and daughter would be there. Although Crown Prince Rhaegar is dead, his widow and children are still alive. Knowing Tywin Lannister, he would order their deaths, too. If you get to them first, maybe you can get them out of the Red Keep and out of King's Landing. That would at least get you in Dorne's good graces.

So... where will you go?
1323312.title: Still try to get into the Red Keep

13233122.content:
As tempting as the thought of ending the Mad King's life yourself is, you decide the risk is too great. You are aware that Jaime Lannister himself is guarding the King, and while you are quite skilled with a blade, your swordsmanship is hilariously inferior to Ser Jaime's. Plus, while you are not looking solely for personal gain, the Martells are more likely to show appreciation for your actions than the Lannisters.

Most of all, even if you actually did manage to kill Aerys and headed to the Maidenvault immediately afterwards, the risk that you would be too late to save Princess Elia and her children is too high. Although you have been alone for so long and no one ever went out of the way for your sake, you cannot bring yourself to allow any harm to come to an innocent woman and her babes.

Thus, you begin searching for the Maidenvault. It takes you a little while, as you have never been inside the Red Keep before, and you are unfamiliar with its layout. You cannot just ask the servants for directions; they would be under no obligation to answer you. If anything, they may try to obstruct or stop you. So, all you can do is rely on instinct and your own judgment.

After riding for about ten minutes, you manage to locate the Maidenvault. Unfortunately, the only way up there is by a spiral staircase. As such, you are forced to leave Aerion behind. As you climb off your horse, you rub his muzzle and whisper "I'll be back soon." He snorts as though he understands.

You rush up the spiral staircase, and you sprint to the chambers designated for the Crown Prince and her family. Once you are there, you lightly knock on the door.

It is answered about ten seconds later by a beautiful woman of twenty-six years. She is a couple inches taller than you, her long, black hair is straight and goes past her shoulders, her skin is slightly tan (as expected of her Dornish heritage), and her face is smooth and flawless. Despite her being taller than you, she has a somewhat petite frame. She is clad in a flowing gown of light colors, which reveals an ample amount of cleavage.

"Who are you?" Princess Elia Martell asks.

You promptly bow your head and declare "My name is Brynden, Your Grace. I beg your forgiveness for this hasty request, but I must ask that you come with me."

Unsurprisingly, she is unwilling to comply. She asks suspiciously "Why should I? Did the king send you?"

"No, no one sent me," you inform her, lifting your head up, "I serve no one but myself. That is why I came here; because I chose to. Your life is in danger. As are the lives of your son and daughter."

THAT has caught her attention. She seems uneasy now, and she asks a little nervously "What do you mean?"

"Tywin Lannister's forces are almost upon us," you tell her, "Aerys believes they are here to assist him. But in actuality, they are here to seize the city and kill the remaining Targaryens. There is no way I can prove the truth of that claim; all I can ask is that you take flight before the lions come for you and your children."

Luckily, Princess Elia does not take too long to make up her mind. "It would not surprise me if Lord Tywin ordered my death and my children's deaths. It would not be the first time he has wiped out an entire family. And even if that is not his intention, I have been a prisoner of the Red Keep for months on end. I would rather take a chance with a total stranger like you than put up with my insane father-by-law and the ruthless Lord of Casterly Rock."

You understand her reasoning, and you smile. You tell her "Then get your children and come with me. And please, hurry. Every second we delay is a second the Lannister forces get closer."

Princess Elia nods and heads back into the room. A minute later, she reappears. She is wearing a cloak, and in her arms, she is holding her son Prince Aegon and her daughter Princess Rhaenys. She also has a large bag slung over her shoulder. You assume those are supplies.

You hastily lead Princess Elia and her children back downstairs. You help her onto Aerion, and then you climb on behind her.

"So, where are we off to?" Elia queries.
13233122.title: The Maidenvault

132331221.content:
"We have to get out of the city," you tell the princess, striking the reins and urging Aerion forward. As you head back towards the entrance of the Red Keep, you remark "By now, the Lannister soldiers are certain to be covering all seven of the gates. If it was just me, I could probably find some way to blend in with them and get through their ranks. But with you and your children, that is no longer any option. Our only other means of escape is by the harbor. We're going there now."

"I understand," Princess Elia says to acknowledge.

Before long, you return to the front of the Red Keep. You have Princess Elia draw up the hood of her cloak so that no one will recognize her. After that, you rush towards the gate. This time, the guards try to stop you, but you gallop straight past them without a second thought.

You discover you left the Red Keep just in time. The Lannister forces have already entered King's Landing, and they have begun pillaging the castle town. Luckily, they are nowhere near the Red Keep or the harbor at this time. Even so, you need to hurry. Princess Elia gives you directions to the harbor, and you follow them accordingly.

About ten minutes later, you arrive in the harbor. It is almost as abandoned as the castle town. Because of that, most of the ships are currently unattended or unmanned. However, to your relief, a vessel with a Dornish captain is present, and the whole crew is already accounted for. When Princess Elia reveals herself to the captain, he immediately agrees to give her and her children asylum and passage out of King's Landing. At first, he is reluctant to do the same for you and Aerion, but the princess insists, and he gives in and lets both of you aboard, too.

Once you, your horse, the princess, her children, the captain, and his crew are all onboard, the vessel swiftly pulls out of the harbor. Nobody tries to stop you, again to your relief. As you sail out into Blackwater Bay, you can still hear screams coming from the city. You frown in sadness. You are glad you were able to save Princess Elia and her children, but you feel for all the innocent people who were left behind. Still, there is nothing to be done. You could not have possibly saved all of them.

Anyway, you have more immediate concerns. Mainly, where to go from here.

"I have no friends in the realm, Your Grace," you tell Princess Elia, "Therefore, I'll leave it to you to decide our destination."

What does she decide?
132331221.title: The Harbor

1323312212.content:
"It would be for the best if we made for Dorne," Elia Martell declares.

"Because your family is there?" you assume.

"That, and there is something there that requires my attention," the Dornish princess replies. She does not say anything more than that. You do not feel the need to press her for further clarification, as it is probably none of your business.

At any rate, Princess Elia orders the captain to sail for their homeland, and he acknowledges and executes the order. Thus begins the long voyage south.

You note that this vessel is not especially large. Living space is a little tight. Each member of the crew has to room with at least two others. In fact, the captain is the only one who has his own quarters. However, he relinquishes those quarters for Princess Elia and her children, and he instead sleeps in the officers' cabin with the other officers.

Due to his size, Aerion has to stay down in the cargo hold. You are content to sleep down there with him, but the princess insists that you deserve better than that, and she offers to share the captain's cabin. It only takes you a few seconds to accept her offer.

When you get to the captain's cabin, you discover there is only one bed. A quite large bed, but still only one. It goes without saying that the princess and her children will sleep there. When it's time to turn in for the night, you'll just find yourself a corner of the room and settle down there. You are used to that routine, after all. Of course, the princess may have other ideas... Even so, you are not going to give your hopes up.

For the time-being, your greatest concern is finding a way to pass the time. For now, you sit on a chair against the wall and read a book. It is a fairly interesting book about the legendary Nymeria Martell. SHE certainly seems like someone who would have made a fine motherly figure. If only you could have been around then!

Oh, well. You suppose you'll find a way to make do.

While you read, Princess Elia tends to her children. Based on the smell, eighteen-month-old Aegon has soiled himself. Fortunately, the odor does not linger for very long; Princess Elia swiftly undresses her son, changes him into fresh nappies, and puts the soiled ones into a bag. After that, she turns her attention to three-year-old Rhaenys. She lifts up her daughter's dress and asks "How are you, sweetheart?"

At that moment, you happen to look up from your book. You discover that Rhaenys is diapered, too. That is surprising; normally, a girl her age would already be trained to use the chamber pot.

"I'm dry, Mummy," the little girl claims proudly. Her mother checks her padding, anyway. After pressing her hand against the front of Rhaenys's diaper, Elia grins and announces "Yes, you are. Good girl."

Rhaenys giggles at her mother's praise. Meanwhile, you turn your attention back to your book. Before you can keep reading, though, Princess Elia says "Alright, you two; feeding time."

In response, you gaze up again, and Princess Elia is in the process of removing her top. Your eyes widen in shock. Has she forgotten you are here? Or maybe she doesn't care if you see this much of her? You knew Dornish women were less reserved about showing their bodies than most other women, but still...

Anyway, Princess Elia takes Rhaenys and Aegon in her arms, and she brings each of them up to one of her breasts. They both latch on and suckle hungrily. So, she really breastfeeds them at this age, too? That is... intriguing.

You try to go back to reading your book, but it is difficult to focus. The sounds of the Targaryen children nursing off their mother and the slight gasps she makes are very distracting. The latter is also a little enticing.

Fifteen minutes later, Princess Elia finishes feeding her son and daughter. She burps both of them, and then she lays them on the bed and begins to tickle them playfully. They giggle in enjoyment.

You have hardly moved at all since this began. Before, you did not know what to think. Now... you simply find yourself incredibly envious of Aegon and Rhaenys. You let out a sigh of frustration.

Somehow, Princess Elia must have heard your sigh. She stops tickling her children, looks up at you, and asks in concern "Is everything alright, Brynden?"
1323312212.title: Dorne

choices: Ask Elia for some time to think on her offer
13233122122.content:
You consider telling her that everything is fine. That you are fine. But if you are being completely honest with yourself, that would be a lie. After all, you are jealous of the treatment she is giving her own son and daughter. How is that fine in any way?!

After hesitating for a long while, you release another deep sigh, and you state "Your Grace... there is something you should know about me."

"I'm listening," says Princess Elia.

You sit up in your chair, set the book aside, look the princess in the eye, and tell her "My family died when I was only six. For the last ten years, I have been on my own. In all that time, I have traveled all over Westeros, seeking out work and taking it wherever and whenever I could. While my upbringing has been rough and challenging, it has prepared me for the hardships of the world, both physically and mentally. Emotionally, however... I am still greatly lacking."

"What do you mean?" the Dornish princess asks.

"I hardly have any memories of my real family," you reveal, "As such, I have often yearned for one. Specifically, I have longed to have someone whom I could call mother. Someone who could nurture, care for, love, and treat me as though I was her own son. So far, I have had no luck in that pursuit, but I am as determined as ever. Still... seeing the way you interact with your own children... it made me somewhat jealous of them. They have everything I have ever wanted. That is the reason for my sigh. If that disgusts or appalls you, I am truly sorry. I'll leave this room right away."

You stand to gather up your belongings, but before you can move an inch away towards your pack, Princess Elia beckons you "Brynden, come here."

You tentatively approach the bed, and you sit down on the spot Elia pats. Unable to look her in the eye, you mutter nervously "Yes, Your Grace?"

Elia Martell pats your shoulder and tells you in a gentle tone "I am sorry you had such a difficult childhood. No one should have to face the world alone. It is perfectly natural of you to desire a mother's love. That type of treatment is what gets children through troubled times and challenges. It even helps to prepare them for adulthood. The fact that you have gone this lone without such a person in your life is admirable, but tragic at the same time. Therefore..."

She pauses here, and you manage to look back up at her. You ask in interest "Therefore?"

A few seconds later, she continues with "What if... I was to treat you the same way as Aegon and Rhaenys?"

You are surprised and delighted at the same time. Hoping you did not mishear the princess, you stutter "A-are you serious?"

Elia firmly nods her head and declares "I owe you my life. And my children's lives. This the very least I could do to repay you. I can also tell you are a good person. You are not the sort of individual who would take advantage of another's kindness. You deserve to be loved. So, if I can help you live out your fantasy of having a proper mother... let me do it. Please."

What do you do?
13233122122.title: The Secret Wish

132331221221.content:
You do not need any time to reflect upon Princess Elia's proposal. Almost immediately, you smile, look her in the eye, and tell her "I would be delighted, Your Grace."

Princess Elia smiles back, clearly pleased with your decision. Then she raises a finger, waves it disapprovingly, and says sternly yet warmly "From now on, you are to call me 'Mummy.'

"As you wish... Mummy," you remark, blushing a bit.

"Very good," Elia mutters in approval. She then stands up, pulls you to your feet, and declares "Now, the first thing to do is to get you dressed appropriately. Let's get you out of those clothes."

You do nothing to protest or resist. You ARE somewhat curious as to what sort of apparel Princess Elia has in mind for you. You see no reason to worry, though. As a mother of two Elia, Martell must know what she is doing.

The Dornish princess reaches up to the clasp of your cloak, unfastens it, and removes it. After folding it up and setting it aside, she helps you out of your leather armor. Your boots, gauntlets, greaves, and breastplate are quickly removed, as is the doublet you wear underneath. Now you are down to your tunic and breeches. She pulls those off of you, too, leaving you in just your smallclothes.

Princess Elia has you remove your smallclothes, as well. Now you are totally naked in front of you. Your hands reflexively rush to cover your groin, but she assures you "No need to be embarrassed. Just lie down and wait for Mummy to dress you."

You obey her and settle down on the bed. You watch Princess Elia as she picks up the large bag she brought along with her. She pulls out a pair of thick white cloth diapers, and she begins folding them together. You murmur in astonishment "Are those... for me?"

"Of course," Elia confirms, "I am raising you as though you were my own babe. All babes wear nappies, and since you are supposed to be a babe, you should be in nappies, too."

"A-alright then," you mutter. You are a little uncertain about being diapered, but you do not want to upset your new mother.

"Don't worry," Princess Elia tells you soothingly, "You'll enjoy them, I promise."

She then lifts your lower body a little and slides the pair of diapers under your bottom. After setting you back down, she gets out some powder and cream, which she applies to your private parts and rubs in thoroughly. Her rubbing excites you greatly, and it causes your manhood to become erect. She just giggles when you get hard, and she coos teasingly "See, Brynden? I told you you'd enjoy them."

You are unable to counter her, mostly due to how excited you are and how right she actually is. Princess Elia does not allow you to orgasm just yet, though. Instead, she pulls the front of the diapers up over your member, forces it down into the padding, and pins the diapers shut on both sides.

Patting the front of your diaper, Elia announces "There we go. Nice and secure."

Aegon and Rhaenys have been playing on the floor all this time. Elia picks them up and places them on the bed between you and her. She tells them "Rhae, Egg, meet your new brother, Brynden."

Aegon does nothing more than babble incoherently. Whereas Rhaenys smiles and waves a bit, saying "Hi..."

"Hi," you return, waving at the cute girl.

While Aegon is still too young to notice unusual things, Rhaenys is already somewhat observant. She points at your diapers and asks "Are you a babe?"

You blush furiously at that. Elia chuckles and tells her daughter "No, sweetheart. He is not a babe."

"But he is in nappies, Mummy," Rhaenys points out, "Only babes wear nappies."

Some might say she raises a good point. Still, shouldn't she have noticed you are much too big to be an actual baby? Then again, she is still only three. She does not have the most pristine powers of deductive reasoning just yet.

132331221221.title: Pampered by the Princess

1323312212212.content:
"Come here, Brynden," says Princess Elia, beckoning you closer with her hand.

You sit up on the bed, get on all fours, and crawl towards the Dornishwoman, your padded bottom swaying in the air behind you. You must look quite babyish right now.

Princess Elia then sets you down on the bed, gets up, and proceeds to undress fully. The next morning, you discover that you wet your nappies in your sleep. You know this for two reasons: your crotch feels damp, and you wake up to Princess Elia changing you. As she pins you into a fresh pair of diapers, she bides you good morning. She then proceeds to breastfeed you again.

As you nurse from the Dornishwoman's lovely bosom, she tells you that the ship is bound for Starfall. You are a little confused to learn that; House Martell's ancestral home is Sunspear. Furthermore, Sunspear is located on the east coast of Dorne, meaning the ship is currently closer to it than any other settlement in Dorne. Whereas Starfall is all the way on the west coast of Dorne. It would take more than twice as long to get there.

Princess Elia must sense your confusion, for she explains the situation a moment later. As she continues nursing you and lovingly caressing your face and body, she reveals that what the world has been told about her husband is a lie. In other words, Princess Rhaegar Targaryen did not kidnap Lady Lyanna Stark; she left with him willingly, as they apparently loved one another. In fact, Elia herself gave Rhaegar her blessing to take Lyanna as his second wife.

Around the time the Rebellion began, Lyanna discovered she was pregnant. For her safety, Rhaegar moved her to the Tower of Joy in Dorne, and he left her with three of his Kingsguard for her protection. Princess Elia's main concern now is to get to Princess Lyanna before she gives birth.

The sea voyage to Starfall takes about a month to accomplish. You spend most of that time in the captain's cabin with Princess Elia and her children, your new "brother" and "sister." You are in diapers for almost every moment, except for when Princess Elia bathes you. Whenever you leave the captain's cabin - which is not very often - you are allowed to put clothes on over your diapers. But whenever you are inside, the only apparel you are permitted is your padding.

Although you had mixed feelings about being diapered at first, you quickly come to enjoy the security, warmth, and comfort associated with them. The best part is that once a day, when Aegon and Rhaenys are sleeping, you have some "quality time" with Princess Elia. That usually involves her teasing you, spanking you, tickling you, or rubbing you off until you climax. Before long, you find yourself soaking your diapers with cum more often than with urine.

After a long but pleasurable month at sea, you arrive at Starfall. After having your diapers changed and getting dressed, you disembark the vessel with your new mother and siblings. Soon after you step onto the docks, the four of you are greeted by another woman. She is around Princess Elia's age, and she is notably tall for a Dornishwoman. Her skin is tan, though slightly less tan than the princess's. She has long black hair, red lips, and violet eyes. Those eyes are what really stand out to you. There is something sensuous about them.

Princess Elia embraces the woman tenderly. Then she introduces you and her to each other: "Ash, this is Brynden, the boy who saved me, Rhae, and Egg from the Lannisters. He is also my new 'son.' More on that later. Brynden, I would like you to meet my best friend, Lady Ashara Dayne."

You had heard of Ashara Dayne. She was the sister of Ser Arthur Dayne, the Sword of the Morning and the deadliest of King Aerys' Kingsguard. She was also one of the most renowned beauties in the Seven Kingdoms. Still, the reports of her beauty hardly do her justice. Secretly, you think she is even more beautiful than Princess Elia. You do not say that aloud, though.

Elia Martell then tells Ashara Dayne of her plans to recover Lyanna Stark. Apparently, Lady Ashara is already fully aware of the truth surrounding that issue. She gives Princess Elia some guards and horses to get her to the Tower of Joy. She also lends her Starfall's maester, in case Princess Lyanna experiences complications while giving birth.

Rhaenys and Aegon will be staying in Starfall until their mother returns. You, however, have the option to join Princess Elia on her journey. Your new mother tells you that if you would rather not go with her, you could stay at Starfall instead. Since she is already looking after Rhaenys and Aegon, Lady Ashara would look after you while the princess is away.

What do you choose?
132331221221212.title: Starfall
