Soon, Dorcas and Senelle have their hands securely tied behind their backs. After that, you have them stand with their backs facing each other. You use the third rope to bind their already-bound hands together. This ensures that they will not be able to slip their hands under their legs.

As you pick up the last rope, you have them sit down on the bed. You wrap this rope several times around their waist, forcing them to keep their backs to each other until you release them.

After checking the knots, you mutter "You're almost a perfect pair of damsels in distress. One thing missing, though. But what?"

You know that if two women really were being held prisoner, their captors would likely cover their eyes to keep them from seeing their surroundings, or cover their mouths to keep them from calling for help.

Which do you do?
1353321221211221222312.title: Role Playing

choices: You find something to use as a prop sword
You just use an air sword (i.e. act like you have one)
13533212212112212223122.content:
While both possibilities have their advantages (in more than one meaning of the word), you think it would be sexier if the maids are unable to speak. You just need something to gag them with...

"Does the que- er, Mummy happen to have any loose pieces of silk?" you ask the maids.

"Yes," Dorcas replies, gesturing to a small cabinet beside the dress closet. "In there. Why do you ask?"

Rather than answering, you waddle over to the cabinet, kneel before it, and open up the top drawer. You manage to find two long, thin, black pieces of silk. You smile and whisper "Perfect."

You close the drawer and waddle back over to the maids. You instruct them "Close your mouths."

They do, and you proceed to pull one of the pieces of silk over each of their mouths. You tie each piece securely at the back of each woman's respective neck. Once you are finished, you tell them "Try to speak now."

They attempt to talk, but all they comes out is muffled garbles. The silk makes a quite effective gag. This certainly is a quaint sight. You are wearing nothing but very thick diapers, yet your intended caretakers are helpless and totally at your mercy. In other words, the Baby has control over his babysitters.

"Alright," you remark, standing over the bound and gagged maids, "Now that you're prepared, let us begin the game. Oh, since I'm the knight, I'll need a sword first, though. Then again, I doubt Mummy would want me to handle an actual sword. So, I'll make do."
13533212212112212223122.title: You gag them

choices: A hundred years before the Targaryens fall (around 183 A.C.)
Shortly before the Targaryens fall (before 283 A.C.)
Shortly after the Targaryens fall (after 284 A.C.)
Shortly before the events of the series (before 298 A.C.)
During the events of the series. (298 A.C.)
14.content:
After thinking for a while, you choose to go south, towards the Reach and Dorne.

Historically, the two southernmost of the Seven Kingdoms have not gotten along with one another. Even so, they were both known for excellent food, pleasant weather, and beautiful women. Those were all a plus to you, particularly the last one.

Thus, you mount your faithful destrier, Aerion, and then you turn south and head in that direction.

After riding alongside the Kingsroad for about a week, you arrive in the Kingswood, just south-southwest of King's Landing.

Before we go any further, there is one thing we should establish: what era does this take place in? Does it take place before/during the events of the books/show? Does it take place before that? When?
14.title: Go South

144.content:
Alright, now that we have an idea of when, let us proceed with the plot.

Once you emerge from the Kingswood, you find yourself on the border of the Reach. Here you have two options. You could either merge onto the Roseroad to take you into the Reach, or you can continue along the Kingsroad all the way to Storm's End, the capital of the Stormlands. From there, you can ride through the Red Mountains, which will lead you to Dorne.

So, what will you do? Will you go to the Reach - the alleged "heart of chivalry" in the realm - or to Dorne, renowned for its very loose practices of sex and drinking? Or do you suppose you might stay in the Stormlands for a time, and see what the Baratheons have to offer?
144.title: Shortly before the events of the series (before...

1442.content:
While the Reach and the Stormlands certainly have their own appeal, you decide Dorne would be the most promising in terms of getting lucky with women. It may be covered with nothing but sand, but while the landscape may not be hospitable, the people certainly are.

Since the Sun is visible for most of the year, the people general wear light or loose clothing. Sometimes they are scantily clad.

Furthermore, a significant percentage of Dornishmen and Dornishwomen are very open-minded on the subject of intimacy. You personally prefer only women, but you are not opposed to having a threesome. Or more...

Anyway, you ride Aerion to the Red Mountains. You make certain to replenish and increase your water supply often. Since you are going to a very arid region, there will not be many opportunities for you to access water unless you stop at a town or holdfast.

Once you emerge south of the Red Mountains, you arrive at the very end of the Kingsroad. From this point onward, there is nothing but miles and miles of sand before you.

Once more, you have several options available. You could turn west and head towards Starfall, the seat of House Dayne. You could continue to go south and arrive at Hellholt, the seat of House Uller. Or you could head east and make for Sunspear, the Seat of House Nymeros Martell.
1442.title: Dorne

14422.content:
Hellholt is the closest, and it is also the birthplace of Ellaria Sand, the illegitimate child of Lord Harmen Uller. While bastards may be shunned everywhere else in the Seven Kingdoms, here in Dorne they are treated just the same as trueborn children. In addition to that, Ellaria Sand is regarded as one of the most beautiful women in the realm, even though she is the paramour of Prince Oberyn Martell and has four daughters with him.

Although Lady Ellaria can normally be found at Sunspear with her lover (or anyplace else he happens to be), there are times when she returns to her father's ancestral home to visit him and her uncle. For all you know, this could be one of those times. The chances of that may be slim, but it could not hurt to check.

It is well-known that Lady Ellaria and Prince Oberyn have a very open relationship. Since they are not married, they often partake in orgies, where they get involved with other members of both sexes. Orgies are not to your liking (unless you're the only man), but you figure that since Lady Ellaria is so open-minded, perhaps she might be interested in you.

It would certainly be worth investigating.

After a couple more days of riding, you come to the Brimstone, the river which Hellholt stands next to. You soon spot Hellholt in the distance, and you make your way there.

Do you get there without hindrance, or does someone intercept you first?
14422.title: Hellholt

144222.content:
As you gallop alongside the Brimstone towards Hellholt, you spot something outside the fortress when you are just a couple miles away from it. You concentrate for a moment, and you realize it is a small group of riders.

They appear to be armed, so you place your hand on the hilt of your sword, but you do not draw it. You do not wish to give them reason to attack you.

Before long, the riders are upon you. There are four of them in total. Interestingly, all four are women. Dornishwomen, based on their complexions.

The oldest of them appears to be in her late thirties or early forties. Nevertheless, she has to be among the top five most beautiful women you have ever seen.

The other three are all in their twenties. One of them is carrying a spear, another is carrying a whip, and the third is dressed like a septa.

It occurs to you that these must be Ellaria Sand and the three eldest Sand Snakes (Oberyn Martell's daughters). From what you recall, the one with the spear must be Obara, the one with the whip must be Nymeria, and the one dressed like a septa must be Tyene. They are Ellaria's stepdaughters.

The four gorgeous but deadly women gradually surround you and Aerion. They do not appear hostile, but you remain on your guard.

"Good day, miladies," you tell them courteously.

"And to you," the oldest woman returns. She sounds friendly enough. "What brings you to these parts?"

"I am looking for work," you claim. That is partly true. You are also looking for some motherly attention, but you decide not to mention that for now.

"You're not a Dornishman," the spear-wielder observes, "You've come a long way south for work."

"I like to leave no stone unturned," you say plainly, "I am a man of many trades. Maybe I could be useful."

"Maybe you could," the oldest woman remarks, looking you over. It is as though she is implying you'd be useful the way a man is useful to a woman. You hope that is the case. "My name is Ellaria. These girls are Obara, Nymeria, and Tyene. What is your name?"

"Brynden," you tell her. You gesture to your horse and added in "This is Aerion. He's been my faithful companion since I was a lad."

"Then how old are you?" asks Nymeria.

"Six and ten," you say, "I will be seven and ten soon."

"Aren't you a little young to be traveling alone?" Tyene notes.

"I've been doing it most of my life," you state, "My family died when I was very young. I've been on my own almost as far back as I can remember."

The women seem slightly dismayed by that news. Ellaria's horse trots forward, and she says "I am sorry for your loss. No one should have to go through life alone."

"I agree," you comment, "Alas, I have gotten by this far. While I manage well enough, there are still times when I yearn for some company."

By now, Ellaria's horse is right next to yours. She smiles and leans forward. Without any warning whatsoever, she places a kiss on your lips. You are surprised and delighted at the same time.

"Consider that your greeting to Dorne," she tells you. You wouldn't mind be "greeted" more than that. "Follow us; we'll take you to Hellholt."

You comply with her instructions. However, as you near the seat of House Uller, you start to feel lightheaded and disoriented. At first, you think it may be sunstroke. But that is unlikely. Before long, you feel as though you are gradually fading out of consciousness. You brace yourself against Aerion, and you pass out

You wake up...
144222.title: You are met by someone

1442221.content:
When you come to, you discover that you are in a darkened room. You also feel as though you are clad in considerably less clothing than you were when you lost consciousness.

Once you regain your senses, you take in your surroundings. You immediately discover two things. Firstly, you are in a windowless room. It must be a bedroom, because you are lying on a bed. Secondly, you are not alone in the room. Or on the bed. Someone's arms are wrapped around your now-bare chest.

You look up, and you realize that Ellaria Sand is holding you close to her. She is clad in a loose nightgown that barely contains her huge bust. She also has a very gentle and inviting (yet seductive) grin on her face.

"Good evening, darling," she tells you softly.

You are a little astounded, a little aroused, and a little frightened all at once. You murmur softly "What happened?"

"You passed out," Ellaria informs you, "I'm to blame for that. Whenever a lone rider comes to Hellholt, I always rub my lips with an potion that knocks one out. When I kissed you, I administered the potion into your body. Once the victim passes out, we decide what to do with them next. Sometimes we throw them in a dungeon, send them back to where they came from, or - if the victim is a known enemy - we cut their throats."

"So, what are you going to do with me?" you ask nervously.

"You needn't worry," she assures you gently, "My people and I are not going to harm you. Sometimes the victim simply wakes up in splendid accommodations, which are theirs for the duration of their stay. YOUR stay, however, may be longer than usual."

"Why is that?" you ask.

"Because you are in dire need of some tender loving care," Ellaria explains, "Living a solitary life as a orphaned nomad... it is almost too sad for words. As such, I mean to provide you with the love and attention you were deprived of."

You begin to wonder if you are still asleep. This is just like one of your many fantasies, and now would be around the time when you woke up. "I am not dreaming, am I?"

"Not unless I am too," Ellaria tells you, smiling, "Nor are you delirious from the effects of that potion. Every word I've spoken is the truth."

You are absolutely thrilled by now. You embrace Ellaria and tell her "Thank you so much."

She just continues to smile and kisses you on the forehead, saying "It is my pleasure. And yours. Now, let me help you sit up."

As you and Ellaria sit up in the bed, you notice that everything below your waist is concealed beneath the covers of the bed. Your upper half is totally naked right now, but you don't know about the state of your lower half.

Once you and Ellaria are sitting up, your lower body appears from underneath the blankets. You discover that you are...
1442221.title: In Ellaria's arms

choices: She rubs your manhood through the front of your diaper
She reaches inside your diaper and pleasures you directly
14422212.content:
To your surprise and confusion, you are wearing only one article of clothing. A thick, white cloth diaper wrapped and pinned tightly around your loins. You have not worn diapers since before your first memory. You wonder why you are in one now.

You gaze up at Ellaria and mutter "Um... may I ask why I'm in a nappy?"

She grins gently and tells you "Three reasons. One, when you lost consciousness, I knew it would at least be several hours before you woke up again. There was a chance you might have relieved yourself before then, so the nappy is a useful precaution. Two, all your clothing - including what you had on when I met you - seemed very starched and scratchy. That includes your smallclothes. I thought a nappy would be a comfortable change. Three... I want to make you my own son. The best way to do that would be to start from the very beginning, back when you actually were in nappies."

All three of those points are very good. You would not have liked to have wet or messed yourself in your sleep, and this diaper was much softer than anything else you had ever worn. Plus... if you really were going to be babied, you may as well go all-out.

Ellaria reaches down and gently places her hand on the front of your diaper. You feel through manhood quiver beneath the padding. A few seconds later, she announces "Excellent. You're still dry."

Even after confirming that your diaper is clean, she keeps her hand on top of your padded crotch. You certainly cannot complain. Still, you wonder about something. You look up at Ellaria and ask "Do you want me to use these nappies for everything?"

"Only if doing so wouldn't make you feel unclean," Ellaria assures you, "I would prefer if you did, though. After all, whenever you need to be changed, it would always be myself or one or your 'sisters' who does it."

Your cock begins to harden once more beneath your diaper. Ellaria notices this and pats it lightly. She comments "Such a big boy."

A moment later, your stomach growls a bit. You remember that you have not eaten since this morning. Thankfully, Ellaria is ready to provide. She slips out of her nightgown, leaving her in just her smallclothes. Then she takes you in her arms again, holds your head up to her right breast, and urges you to take it.

You hesitate a little, but you manage to latch onto her nipple and begin to suck. Within moments, rich, warm milk starts flowing into your mouth.

As Ellaria breastfeeds you, you feel as though you are in pure bliss. For the third time, your manhood starts to form a small tent in your diapers.

Ellaria notices the tent in your diaper, and what does she do about it?
14422212.title: diapered

choices: She has you drink from her left breast, too
She has you pleasure her now
144222121.content:
You are in the midst of suckling on Ellaria's right breast, and she has her right arm securely wrapped around you. Your attention is focused solely on feeding, whereas Ellaria is focused on the tent in your padding. While you drink her milk, she slowly reaches down, presses her left hand against the front of your diaper, and begins rubbing.

You gasp in surprise, almost leaking milk out of your mouth. Thankfully, Ellaria holds you firmly against her chest, preventing you from unlatching. You gaze up at her apprehensively, and she just grins and tells you "Relax, sweetie. Just keep drinking, and Mummy will give you a little treat."

Since you cannot really protest the situation, you obey her. As Ellaria's sweet, warm milk continues flowing into your mouth, she continues rubbing your padded crotch. Over the next few minutes, her rubbing becomes firmer and faster. At the same time, you increase the pace of your suckling, and you are humping into her hand.

Finally, after five minutes, you hit your peak, and you orgasm into your nappies. At approximately the same time, you drain Ellaria's right breast, and you finally pull away. Ellaria gently lowers you onto the bed, keeping her right arm around your back.

As you ease down from the pleasure you've just received, Ellaria smiles and pats your padded crotch. The front of your diaper is soaked with your cum, while she feels. Ellaria giggles and mutters "Good baby; making a big boy mess in his nappies."

You blush at this, but you find that you like the teasing.

What happens next?
144222121.title: Rubbed By Mummy

145.content:
As you know full well, Robert Baratheon was the king of the Seven Kingdoms for fifteen years, between 283 A.C. and 298 A.C.

Growing up, you had heard some very mixed and varied views of Robert. He may have been an excellent and formidable commander of armies, but the popular opinion was that his capacity as a king left much to be desired.

In spite of that, neither you nor anyone else in the realm had any idea just how chaotic Westeros would become once Robert Baratheon died.

On that subject, does this take place before, during, or after the War of the Five Kings? In other words, who sits the Iron Throne?
145.title: During the events of the series. (298 A.C.)

1452.content:
The year is 299 A.C. Currently, the noble houses of Westeros are at war. The war began only recently after the death of King Robert Baratheon, but it has already spread throughout the entire realm. It is being called the war of the Five Kings. Those five kings are Robb Stark (for the North and Riverlands), Balon Greyjoy (for the Iron Islands), Renly Baratheon (for the Reach and part of the Stormlands), Stannis Baratheon (for the rest of the Stormlands and part of the Crownlands), and Joffrey Bartaheon (for the rest of the Crownlands and the Westerlands). At present, the Vale and Dorne are the only two of the nine regions that are neutral or have not declared for anyone yet.

Since you headed south, you can only choose between three of those nine places.

Dorne would likely be the safest, given Prince Doran Martell's reputation for avoiding conflict and relying more on patience, reasoning and sound judgment. Plus, Dornish women are renowned for their beauty.

The Stormlands would be a little riskier, given the conflicting loyalties of its nobles. Still, you would be able to see firsthand what both of the remaining Baratheon brothers were up to, and after a while, you could decide if you would throw in with either of them.

However, in terms of popularity and strength, Renly seems to have the greatest odds of triumphing over the other kings. With that in mind, you suppose your best opportunities to find work (and a caring motherly figure) would lie with following the late King Robert's youngest brother. At present, Renly is in the Reach with the whole of his forces.

Where will you go?
1452.title: During (Joffrey is the King)

choices: Yes, it is just you and Aerion until you get there
No, you come across some fellow travelers
14523.content:
You decide to try to join up with Renly's forces.

The night you stayed at that inn at the crossroads last week, you had learned a lot of interesting things by listening in on the other patrons' conversations. Eavesdropping may not have uncouth, but you had to use whatever resources you could.

One thing you had heard was that the entirety of Renly's forces had been camped at Bitterbridge for a couple weeks, and apparently, they would likely be there for quite a while longer.

You also heard a rumor that Stannis planned to lay siege to Storm's End soon, the ancestral home of House Baratheon. Storm's End was currently held by Renly, but Stannis was willing to seize the castle, even if by force.

Lastly, you heard a rumor that Balon Greyjoy was planning to launch a campaign against the North. That would not mean good news for Robb Stark, as most of their bannermen were fighting in the south.

Neither of the latter reports really troubled you, though. The quarrels between nobles were the business of nobles, too. As a commoner, it was none of YOUR concern.

"Alright, Aerion," you mutter to your faithful destrier, "We're off to the Reach."

After emerging from the Kingswood, you cross over from the Riverlands into the Reach. Shortly after this, you turn Aerion southwest and continue in that direction.

Do you make it to Bitterbridge without encountering anyone?
14523.title: The Reach

145232.content:
You accomplish most of your journey without encountering anything or anyone else. That gives you time to marvel at your surroundings. You note how fertile, green, and lush the land is. Evidently, the rumors of the Reach's beauty were not embellished.

When you are less than a day's ride from Bitterbridge, you finally happen across another party. This one is quite large. There are at least thirty men, all of whom are gathered protectively around one woman.

"Who goes there?" one of them calls out to you, placing a hand on the hilt of his sword. He does not draw it, but you do not doubt he will if he deems it necessary. Most of his companions seem to be of a like mind.

Hoping to avoid a hostile confrontation, you calmly call out "No one of importance, I assure you, good ser. I am but a humble traveler, roaming the land and searching for work wherever I can."

You sound believable enough. At least you hope you do; that IS the truth, after all. Thankfully, the mounted men seem a little less wary of you.

"What is your name?" the woman asks.

"Brynden, milady," you inform her. You note her auburn hair, her eyes, and her complexion. You ask "Forgive me my impertinence, but would you happen to be Lady Catelyn Stark?"

The woman's eyes widen a little in surprise, but she lightly nods her head. One of her soldiers asks suspiciously "How do you know that?"

"Although I have been all over the Seven Kingdoms, I am originally from the Riverlands," you reply, bowing your head respectfully, "I can easily recognize one with the coloring of the Tullys of Riverrun."

Lady Catelyn lightly grins at that. "I see. May I ask what you are doing out here all on your own?"

"As I said before, milady, I am looking for work," you inform her, "With the war going on, my options have expanded greatly. I concluded that my best prospects might lie with King Renly, so I am on my way to Bitterbridge to visit his camp. No offense meant to your son or those that follow him."

"No offense was taken, my boy," she assures you, "Since you are no one's sworn vassal, you are free to align with whomever you please. However, might I ask how old you are?"

"Six and ten," you inform her.

Lady Catelyn is surprised. "Then you're younger than my eldest son," she remarks.

That amazes you. You are younger than King Robb? The auburn-haired lady says "You are not even a man grown, yet you are traveling all by yourself?"

"That's correct, milady," you confirm, "Please, do not let it trouble you. I've lived this way for the past eight years, and I've gotten by just fine."

"That may be," says Catelyn, "But the realm was not at war for the last eight years. Now, it is dangerous for grown MEN to be wandering the land alone. For a growing lad such as yourself to do the same..."

You simply shrug at that. You've always been good at avoiding dangerous encounters. The only ones you ever got involved in were the ones where you had an excellent chance of emerging triumphant. Still, Lady Catelyn seems genuinely concerned, and only a scoundrel would put a lady in such distress. You say "Might I ask what you believe I should do instead?"

"We are on our way to Bitterbridge, as well," Lady Catelyn informs you, "If you wish, you may join my company until we get there. Then you can decide where you'd like to go from there."

You are astonished by her kind offer, but you do not accept it straightaway. You wonder; would it really be alright to accept her hospitality, even if only for a day? After all, you had not really done anything to earn it. Then again, it is not as though you would be imposing on anyone.
145232.title: Company in the Reach

choices: That night at camp; Lady Catelyn comforts you
Skip to the next morning; arrival at Bitterbridge
1452321.content:
Ultimately, you softly grin and say "Very well, milady. I thank you for your kind offer, and I will try my hardest not to be a burden to you or yours."

Catelyn Stark smiles back at you and says "It is no bother, my boy. No one should have to travel alone in time of war."

You soon resume heading south towards Bitterbridge, this time with at least thirty other people. You have to admit; while you are used to travelling by yourself, traveling with others is pleasant, as well. You can sometimes get lonely with only Aerion for company.

After riding for a few hours, Lady Catelyn calls for everyone to stop and make camp.
1452321.title: Accept graciously

14523212.content:
The next morning, a couple hours before noon, you, Lady Catelyn, and her retainers finally arrive at Bitterbridge, A scout comes out to greet all of you, and you are escorted to Renly's camp.

When you arrive at Bitterbridge, you discover a type of tourney is going on. Two knights clad in full-body armor are going at each other in earnest. A young black-haired man with a matching beard is seated on a throne, observing the duel. Beside him is a gorgeous woman with a thin waist, brown hair, and... a larger-than-average bosom. That must be his queen, Margaery Tyrell. Thousands of spectators are crowded around the circle, cheering them on.

Lady Catelyn decides not to interrupt the duel. You and she just watch it play out.

Eventually, the taller, more muscular knight wins. As the loser struggles back to his feet, he pulls off his helm. Based on how closely his features resemble the queen's, you figure he must be her brother, Loras Tyrell.

The winner's helm is removed, as well, and you discover it is a woman. Renly acknowledges this woman's victory, addressing her as Brienne of Tarth, also known as Brienne the Beauty.

(This next choice you pick may be a little canon-divergent. Is Brienne still as homely as she is supposed to be in the books and show, or is she actually quite beautiful instead?)
14523212.title: Skip to the next morning; arrival at Bitterbridge

145232122.content:
Brienne of Tarth is a stunningly gorgeous. She has long blond hair, currently tied up in a hairnet to keep it from flowing everywhere. Her face - though currently a little red and covered in sweat - is free of all blemishes. Her toned, enormous figure compliments her face very nicely. You can hear a lot of the surrounding spectators make comments on her desirable appearance. You just stay silent and admire her beauty quietly.

Renly orders for Brienne of Tarth to approach him and kneel. She does as she is told, and he proceeds to reward her for her victory. He knights her and incorporates her into his Rainbow Guard, which is his equivalent of the Kingsguard. Each one of the Rainbow Guard is draped in a cloak a different color. For Brienne, the color is blue.

Once Brienne the Blue is standing beside her king, Renly finally turns his attention to his guests. He beckons Lady Catelyn and her retainers to come forward. You consider staying back and blending into the crowd, but Lady Catelyn gestures for you to accompany them. You comply, and you have Aerion ride alongside her horse.

When you, Catelyn Stark, and her thirty-so men are in the center of the dueling ring, Renly smiles and declares "Welcome, all of you, to the Reach. I am Renly Baratheon, King of the Seven Kingdoms. This fair maiden beside me is my bride and queen, Margaery Tyrell."

It appears you were right about the girl; she IS Renly's queen. She blushes a little at her husband's praise.

Lady Catelyn dips her head respectfully and declares "Good day to you, my lord. I am Lady Catelyn of House Stark, and I come on behalf of my son, Robb Stark, the King of the North."

You hear someone call out "There is only one true king of Westeros!" In response, several other people start yelling similar things.

A few seconds later, Renly gestures for silence, and once everyone quiets down, he stands and announces "Greetings, Lady Catelyn. Might your vassals introduce themselves, as well? I would know who all has gathered before me."

"As you wish, Your Grace," Lady Catelyn remarks. She sounds reluctant to call him that, but does so grudgingly. Each of the men who accompanied her to the Reach proceed to give his name, as well. You manage to remember a few, such as Wendel Manderly, Lucas Blackwood, Robin Flint, and Perwyn Frey.

Eventually, all twenty-five of Lady Catelyn's guards have given his name to King Renly. Right now, you are the only one who has not spoken. You wonder if Renly will ask you to introduce yourself, as well. You do not think it likely. After all, given your poor clothing, your unclean appearance, and the way you hold yourself, you really stand apart from Lady Catelyn and her men.
145232122.title: Brienne the Actual Beauty

1452321222.content:
Despite the obvious signs of your low birth, Renly turns his gaze towards you and asks "And just who might YOU be?"

You are taken aback at being called out by this self-proclaimed king. Still, you remain calm and announce "My name is Brynden, if it please you, Your Grace."

Renly nods in approval at the manner of your introduction. "Are you part of Lady Catelyn's honor guard, as well?"

"Alas, I am not, Your Grace," you tell him, "I am not among Lady Catelyn's vassals. I simply happened to come to this place whilst traveling in her company."

"So I see," Renly remarked, eying you in interest, "Who are you for, then? Are you for Robb or for myself?"

You choose your words carefully: "I am for whichever man proves himself just and worthy to be the king."

Renly seems impressed. "That is a very good answer. Your sentiment is one I share. Fealty is something that must be earned, not given out freely. All these people who surround you... they have deemed me the most suitable man to rule them. They trust in me. They have faith in me. What would convince you to do the same?"

You are a little perplexed by that question. "I do not mean to sound impertinent, Your Grace, but why would you care so much for MY fealty? I am just one mere commoner."

"A single person's choices and actions can make all the difference in a war," Renly debates, "Tell me; where were you before you came here?"

"I was in the Riverlands, Your Grace," you answer him, "After spending a few days in the Kingswood, I came here from the east. Although it is not my place to say, you may elect to head back the way I came."

Renly is intrigued by that. "How do you mean?"

Recalling what you heard at that inn, you tell the black-haired man "I have heard that your brother, Lord Stannis, means to lay siege to Storm's End."

A wave of silence passes over the area. It lasts a full minute, and it ends when Renly asks "What?" He sounds uneasy.

"That's the word going around the Riverlands, Your Grace," you tell him. Apparently, Renly had no idea what his elder brother was up to. This may have been a chance for you to curry favor with him. You then look to the woman beside you, and you tell her "On that note, Lady Catelyn, you may wish to send a raven to King Robb or your other sons in Winterfell. I just remembered also hearing that the Ironborn may attempt to invade the North, as well."

Predictably, Lady Catelyn and her vassals are stunned. Some of Renly's soldiers are equally taken aback.

All of a sudden, Queen Margaery chuckles and tells her royal husband "Isn't THIS interesting, my love? This young man seems to be better informed than us or anyone in our company."

"Or maybe not," Loras counters his sister, eying you warily, "For all we know, he could be a spy from Stannis or Joffrey, sent to mislead or misinform us."

"You have every right to assume the worst of me, good ser," you mutter calmly, gazing around at the gathered masses, "Most of you did not know me before today. You have no reason to trust or believe in anything I say. I myself am not too confident in the accuracy of what I've told you; it amounts to little more than gossip and rumors."

"Nevertheless," Lady Catelyn mutters, "If the Ironborn were to attack us, now would be the ideal time to do so. The North is only sparsely defended."

"And I would not put it past Stannis to make an attempt on Storm's End," Renly mutters, "He has always longed for it, ever since the day Robert named me its master."

"What are we going to do, Your Grace?" Brienne asks. She and every other person there who has sided with Renly look to their king for guidance.

He sits thinking for a few minutes, and then he announces "We have lingered in the Reach long enough. It is past time we stirred. Even if the information supplied by young Brynden here turns out to be false, we would still be in a position of strategic advantage over Stannis and Joffrey. So, all of you, get your rest tonight. For tomorrow, we march!"

This is met with a chorus of cheers all around the dueling ring. Soon, the crowd begins to disperse, and everyone goes their separate ways.

As the area clears up, Renly Baratheon looks to Catelyn Stark and tells her "I appreciate your coming all this way to treat with me, my lady. I assure you that you did not come this far for naught. I am more than willing to discuss the possibility of alliance on the march, if you would accompany us."

"Very well, Your Grace," Catelyn concedes.

"As for you..." Renly mutters, turning towards you, "Who are you, really?"

"Just what I claimed to be, Your Grace," you inform him, "A simple traveler who looks for and takes work wherever he can find it."

"There's plenty of it here, if you are interested," Renly offers.

You grin and say "I am very much interested, Your Grace."

Renly seems pleased. He turns to the tall female knight beside his throne and tells her "Brienne...
1452321222.title: Addressed by the King

14523212221.content:
"Take care of this boy, if you would," Renly orders the sole female member of his Rainbow Guard.

The tall blonde woman lightly nods and remarks "As you command, Your Grace."

She slowly approaches you and makes a gesture with her head, saying "Come this way, please."

After bidding farewell to Lady Catelyn and her retainers, you follow Lady Brienne. You are still mounted, whereas she is on the ground. Yet your height is only slightly greater than hers. She must be even taller than you thought.

A few minutes later, Brienne brings you to an elaborate pavilion. You immediately note its size. Its interior must be at least ten times larger than that of the tent you carry in your supply pack.

"Is this where you sleep, my lady?" you assume.

"No, this is one of the tents reserved for the king's honorable guests," she informs you, somewhat stoically. She then smiles a bit and says "But if you wish it, I could stay the night."

You realize what she is implying. "Are you saying this tent... is intended for me?"

"Yes, my lord," she tells you, nodding her head.

"Please, don't call me that," you beseech her, your humility suddenly taking over, "I am no lord. I am just a simple commoner. Such elegant accommodations like these are hardly befitting for one such as I."

"The king has decreed otherwise," Brienne mutters, "If you wish it, I could relay your dissatisfaction to His Grace."

"No, no, please do not," you hastily tell her, "I will accept these lodgings, even if they are above one of my standing."

"Do not think so low of yourself," Brienne advises you, not unkindly, "I know what it is like to doubt one's sense of worth, but you must not let it hinder your true capabilities."

"If you say so, milady," you mutter. After climbing off Aerion and securing him to a rail outside, you enter the pavillion. Brienne enters right after you. The interiors impress you. There is a bed, a table, some chairs, and even a tub.

"Would you care for a bath?" Brienne offers.

"Oh, yes," you reply straightaway, assuming you would be bathing yourself, "I haven't taken one in over a week."

"Alright, I will have the maids fetch hot water," Brienne tells you, "But first... would you like some help getting undressed?"

How do you reply?
14523212221.title: The Beauty's Charge

145232122211.content:
You are alarmed by the abruptness of that offer, as well as the implication of it. Nevertheless, you feel you'd be a fool to decline. So, you gaze up at Brienne and tell her, somewhat nervously "Ummm... certainly. As long as you've no problem with it."

Brienne merely grins and tells you "I assure you, there is no problem at all."

You have always been a little shorter than the average man. This woman is clearly much taller than the average woman. The difference in height alone is enough to make you realize how odd this setting is. Still, Brienne IS very beautiful, and despite her prowess in battle, she looks as though she has a gentle touch.

As it happens, she does. You find that out a moment later, when she begins to undress you. She starts with the outermost layer, which is your leather armor. She removes your breastplate, greaves, gauntlets, and boots. After that, she removes the doublet you wear underneath. Now you are in your tunic and breeches, which she removes as well. Now, you are in just your smallclothes. Thankfully, she doesn't remove those.

"Now, you go ahead and get settled in the tub," she instructs you, "I'll be right back with the maids and the hot water."

You anxiously nod in acknowledgment, and you walk over to the tub and climb in. You still keep your smallclothes on, as you do not wish to expose your private parts just yet.

About ten minutes later, Brienne returns with three maids. Each of them is carrying a bucket of steaming hot water. The maids catch a glimpse of you, blush, and giggle. At being seen half-naked, you blush, too. Brienne then dismisses the maids, and she brings the six buckets over to the tub. She then asks very seriously "Would you like me to wash you?"
145232122211.title: "Ummm... certainly."

choices: Get some rest (skip ahead to the evening)
1452321222112.content:
Again, you are surprised, but after thinking for a minute, you answer with "I suppose so. Only if you do not mind, though."

"I don't," she assures you. She then unfastens her breastplate and sets it on the ground. Then she slips off the layer of chainmail she is wearing underneath. She then removes the rest of her armor until she is down to her own tunic and breeches. The tunic must be a little small for her, given how her large breasts strain against it. Her nipples are clearly visible through the tunic, as well.

"Why are you undressing, too?" you ask, bewildered.

"I do not wish to risk getting my armor wet," Brienne informs you, "It would be bad if rusted somehow. Besides... the tourney is over, and I am not guarding my king. There is no reason for me to be in armor at the present."

"That makes sense," you mutter in agreement.

Brienne then starts to pour the contents of the buckets into the tub, alarming you. As she empties each one in quick succession, she remarks "You may wish to remove those" and gestures to your smallclothes.

You meekly nod your head, turn your back towards her, and remove your smallclothes. You blush furiously and sink into the water. It is almost scaling hot, but not nearly boiling.

Brienne proceeds to wash you up. As she washes your hair, you say "May I ask why you are doing this for me, my lady? A maiden as beautiful and as strong as you shouldn't trouble herself with such a menial task."

Now, Brienne blushes from being addressed as "beautiful." It is as though she is unused to that label. Then she tells you "You may think so, but I do not mind. Any task King Renly gives me, I accept with eagerness. Aside from that... I enjoy caring for those younger than myself."

You suppose those are both good reasons. "In any case, thank you."

"You are quite welcome," she tells you. After rinsing your hair, she scrubs your chest and back next. She notes how toned your arms and chest are. "You seem to be in excellent physical condition."

"I try to be," you tell her. Despite your below-average height, you have a very strong physique, which you have built up and consistently maintained throughout your life in order to survive all on your own. Although there is no chance you are as strong as Brienne, if SHE is impressed by your muscles, that might say something about your chances with women.

Brienne does your arms and legs next, and she insists on washing your bottom and groin, as well. Somehow, she talked you into letting her. Then again, it may not have taken as much convincing as one might think. You notice she seems impressed with what is... down there. She can feel how stiff you get from her touch. Luckily, you don't go off.

Once you are totally clean, Brienne helps you step out of the bath, and she towels you off vigorously. Once you are dry, she helps you dress in a fresh pair of breeches and a new tunic, and over that, she puts you in a soft, silken robe.

"There we go," she says proudly, "Now, it is almost noon. Would you care for something to eat, or would you rather get some rest?"

What do you decide?
1452321222112.title: Let her wash you

choices: "I would be most grateful if you did."
14523212221122.content:
You ended up spending the whole rest of the day in that pavilion. You took both your lunch and your dinner there. Luckily, the servants and Lady Brienne did not mind bringing you your food there. You were glad for that; the last thing you wanted was to inconvenience anyone or overstep your bounds. Still, you wanted to enjoy this treatment while it lasted. You had a feeling it would end soon.

In the late evening, when everyone is about to settle down for the night, Lady Brienne tells you that you have a visitor. She lets this individual in, and it turns out to be Lady Catelyn.

"Good evening, milady," you tell her courteously, "What do I owe this honor?"

"I simply wished to see how you were faring," she informs you, "I also want to thank you for telling me about the possibility of an Ironborn invasion in the North. I have already sent messages to Winterfell and Riverrun. My sons should receive them soon enough. Once they do, any attempt made by the Ironborn to seize the North should be put down swiftly."

"That is good to hear," you mutter, "Might I ask how your talks with King Renly have gone? Are you any closer to forging an alliance between his forces and King Robb's."

"As of yet, no," Lady Catelyn admits, "But I am not giving up so easily. I am holding out hope that King Renly will listen to reason."

"I may have a potential solution," you tell her, "Of course, neither you nor King Renly are under any obligation to heed any counsel I have to offer, but if one or both of you are interested, I would be happy to share it."

"If you honestly believe it has a chance of success, and as long as it does not involve bloodshed, I would be willing to consider just about any approach at this point," Lady Catelyn tells you, "Let's not worry on this for the present, however. It has been a long time, and there will be plenty of time for negotiations on the morrow."

"Very well, milady," you mutter, "I am just about to turn in, anyway."

She nods at that, and you assume she is going to go to her own tent. However, before she moves to go anywhere, she states "Would you... like me to sit with you until you fall asleep?"

How do you respond?
14523212221122.title: Later that night...

choices: Queen Margaery is standing above you
145232122211221.content:
"I would be most grateful if you did, milady," you tell Lady Catelyn sincerely, "But I do not wish for you to go out of your way for my sake."

"You need not worry, my boy," the Lady of Winterfell assures you, "I would be happy to sit with you. And, if it helps to set your mind at ease, I am not offering to do so solely for your sake. I have not seen my son Robb in weeks. I have not seen my other sons or my daughters in far longer. Until I am reunited with them, I am hoping to find a way to fill the hole in my heart. At this moment, you are perhaps the closest thing I have."

That surprises you. "Is that so, milady?"

"It is," Lady Catelyn claims, "Now, let me help you settle down for the night."

You nod in compliance and walk over to the bed. After lying down on it, Catelyn Stark pulls the blankets over you. She then does something unexpected; she tucks you in. You have no memories of your own mother or any other woman ever tucking you. This is a rather heartwarming experience.

As she smooths down your covers, you say "Milady, I want you to know how thankful I am. Please relay that thanks to Lady Brienne and King Renly, too."

Catelyn Stark turns to you and remarks "I shall. But I must say, Brynden; You almost sound as though you feel you do not deserve it."

"Well, I am very unused to this kind of treatment," you admit, "I am also quite stunned to be given it so freely. I've done nothing to earn it,"

"I disagree," Lady Catelyn counters, "You may have averted a crisis in the North and shortened a feud between House Baratheon. Furthermore, you have endured the wilderness on your own for so long. I would say you are more than entitled to be pampered a little."

You do not know what to say to that. You mutter "You make a good argument. Truthfully, I have often wished to be spoiled. But at the same time, I do not wish to appear, act, or come off as selfish."

"You are not selfish," Catelyn assures you, "Your modesty is proof of that."

She then reaches over and begins stroking your forehead gently. It is a soothing gesture, and it quickly calms you down. Lady Catelyn tells you softly "Now, get some rest. We have a long march ahead of us, and you need to be well-rested."

Her touch and her words are enough to bring you into a state of bliss. You quickly fall fast asleep, and you do not wake up until daybreak.

When you open your eyes the following morning...
145232122211221.title: A Lovely Lady at your Bedside

1452321222112212.content:
Lady Catelyn is no longer with you when you wake up. However, someone younger and even more beautiful has taken her place.

Margaery Tyrell, the daughter of Highgarden and King Renly's queen, is standing over you, smiling sweetly.

You hastily sit up and bow to her in reverence. You stammer "G-g-good morning to you, Y-your Grace."

Margaery continues to smile and calmly says in response "Good morning to you, as well, Brynden."

You keep your head bowed for a little while longer. Then you look up and ask "What brings you here? Is there anything you require of me?"

"Only for you to rise and prepare for the day," the queen tells you, "After breakfast, Renly will be riding straight for Storm's End. He will be taking the vanguard and all of his cavalry with him. He would like you to join them."

"If the king commands it, I shall oblige," you state, trying to sound formal. You swiftly get up from your bed and look around for your clothes. Your armor and doublet is still on the ground by the foot of the bed, but your tunic, breeches, and smallclothes are nowhere to be seen. It is possible the maids came when you were sleeping and took them to be washed. Luckily, those were not the only regular clothes you owned. You have more in your supply pack.

You begin to approach the entrance of your tent, but Queen Margaery stops you and asks "Where are you going?"

"To fetch my supply pack off my horse," you answer her, "I need a change of garments, and that's where they are."

"You should have said so," Margaery remarks, grinning again. She calls out "Brienne, would you get Brynden's supply pack from his mount and bring it in here?"

"Certainly, Your Grace," you hear the female knight's husky yet feminine voice reply from without. Less than twenty seconds later, she enters the tent. She is dressed in her armor and blue cloak once again, and she is carrying your supply pack.

As you graciously take the pack from Brienne of Tarth, you turn to Queen Margaery and ask "By any chance, will you be joining the march, Your Grace?"

"No," she tells you, "If effort to reach Storm's End before Stannis, Renly is only setting out with his fastest units. The bulk of his forces will set out in a few days, and all non-combatants - including myself - will be in that company."

"I wish you safe travels," you bid the queen.

"You, as well," Queen Margaery returns, "Now, once you are dressed, Lady Brienne will escort you to my and Renly's tent. We would like you and Lady Catelyn to break your fast with us."

"As you wish," you say to acknowledge. After the queen leaves, Brienne proceeds to help you out of your sleepwear and into a fresh tunic and breeches. She then helps you into your doublet and leather armor, as well. Just like last night, her touch is motherly and gentle. A bit of contrast to her strong and somewhat intimidating appearance.

She leads you to Renly and Margaery's tent, where you break your fast with Lady Catelyn. You notice Lady Catelyn, Lady Brienne, and Queen Margaery all seem somewhat invested in whether or not you are eating enough. That could be do to your slightly short stature.

Once you've eaten the morning meal, you return to Aerion, mount him thusly, and depart for Storm's End with King Renly, Lady Catelyn, her retainers, Lady Brienne, and the whole of Renly's vanguard and cavalry.
1452321222112212.title: Visit from the Queen

14523212221122122.content:
After riding for over a fortnight, you finally reach your destination. As you rapidly approach the eastern shore, you spot the Baratheon stronghold of Storm's End in the distance.

It has been a long couple weeks. You have spent most of that time in the presence of Lady Catelyn, Lady Brienne, and King Renly. Since you have been in the eastern half of the Seven Kingdoms for the last year, you talk to them about how the war has impacted that half of the realm. So far, the Stormlands and the Crownlands are relatively untouched, whereas the Riverlands have suffered the worst damage.

You have also told King Renly about your idea of a possible working alliance between him and King Robb. What you did was propose to Renly that he allow Robb to retain his title of "King in the North" so long as he swore not to rebel against Renly's forces and to continue their trade and diplomatic relations with the rest of the Seven Kingdoms from before the war began. He could also acknowledge Renly as the true King of the realm, and the two kings could work together to resolve conflicts that occurred between their two nations.

While Renly was uncertain about this proposal at first, he took a week to think about it carefully. The day before you arrived at Storm's End, he told you that your proposal actually did have merit. As of now, he still has not agreed to allow Robb to remain the King in the North for good, but he and his advisors will think on a way to make such an arrangement work. You hope they reach some form of compromise. After all, if Renly's forces combined with Robb's, the war would likely end much sooner.

Anyway, once you arrive at Storm's End, Renly has his forces set up camp once again. You are given the same pavilion from before, much to your delight.

Lady Brienne and Lady Catelyn tend to spend just as much time with you as they did at Bitterbridge, with the former helping you dress, undress, and bathe and the latter tucking you in at night and lulling you to sleep.

After a few days of waiting, Lord Stannis Baratheon arrives on the scene. At a glance, you can tell that the older Baratheon's forces are much smaller than the younger's. Renly's vanguard and cavalry alone greatly outnumber the entirety of Stannis's units. The Lord of Dragonstone does not stand a chance if it actually comes to battle.

Nevertheless, as soon as he arrives, Stannis calls for a parley, which Renly agrees to. Lady Catelyn agrees to come along so that she can speak for King Robb. Interestingly, Renly invites you to attend the parley, too, even though you have no official status.
14523212221122122.title: Skip ahead to Storm's End

145232122211221222.content:
Although you are flattered that Renly thought to include you at the negotiations, you feel as though you would be quite out of place. In fact, your presence may actual be somewhat detrimental to Renly's image, as it may lead Stannis to incorrectly assume that you represent most of his young brother's soldiers. You explain this to Renly, and thankfully, the king understands your decision.

Before noon, King Renly and Lady Catelyn head out to the parley, taking several of their guards and vassals with them. Lady Brienne is one of those who accompany them. You have no one but Aerion to keep you company for the duration of the parley. Normally, you would not mind that. However, after having these courteous highborn hosts for the last two weeks, you strangely find yourself a little hollow.

Luckily, the feeling does not last long. Renly, Catelyn, and their retainers return after less than an hour. Apparently, the parley did not go well. No blows were exchanged; only words. But no one was left satisfied by the end of it. Despite everyone's best efforts, they were unable to reach a compromise.

Evidently, it would come to battle after all. Renly tells you "Stannis has left us no choice. Tomorrow... I must fight him."

You notice he sounds sorrowful. That is actually a little reassuring. As vain and haughty as Renly may be, he still appreciates the value of family.

Later that night, Renly summons you and Lady Catelyn to his tent. When you two get there, Lady Brienne is helping him into his armor

Renly tells you his plans for tomorrow. He will have you, Lady Catelyn, and her men abstain from fighting, but he wants all you to observe the battle. He claims the purpose is so that you all can witness what he is capable of, as well as what he does to those who oppose him. You hope that is not a threat. Given how relations between Renly and Catelyn have been improving for the last fortnight, it probably is not. Still, a serious king does not make idle threats.

Just when Brienne finishes dressing Renly in his armor, you abruptly feel quite cold. Lady Catelyn appears to feel the same, and the light seems to dim slightly.

Right then, something enters the tent. You have no idea what it is, but it is black and gaseous. You suddenly feel as though you are in the presence of danger. However, the black entity does not come toward you. It is moving towards Renly!
145232122211221222.title: Stay at Camp

choices: On the ground of Renly's tent; him, Catelyn, and Brienne
In your bed in your tent; Margaery and her handmaids
1452321222112212221.content:
You hastily rush forward and yell "Your Grace, look out!"

"Hmmm?" Renly says, surprised by your outburst. By now, the black entity is almost upon him. It seems to form what looks like a blade. It means to plunge this blade into Renly's back.

You roughly shove Renly out of harm's way. He falls to the ground just before the black entity can stab him. The entity DOES manage to inflict harm onto you, though. Its blade grazes your side. Although the blade appears to be made of shadow, the sharpness is quite real. So is the pain. But you pay no mind to the pain.

The entity does not attack you again. Instead, it turns away from you, and it moves towards Renly again. Lady Brienne draws her sword and slashes at the entity, but her blade goes right through it. She fails to impede or stop it in any way. Evidently, steel is ineffective against a shadow.

You frantically wonder what WILL harm this entity. Then you realize... if it IS made of shadow, shouldn't light work against it?

You run over to the nearest torch, pull it out of its sconce, and rush back over to the entity, which is about to attack Renly again. You raise the torch and plunge it into the entity's center. The effect is immediate; the entity lets out a high-pitched shriek and begins to dispel. Once it has dispelled completely, it emits a force. The force is so strong that it throws you off your feet. You hit your head when you land on the ground, and despite your attempts to remain conscious, you quickly pass out.

Where are you when you regain consciousness, and who is with you?
1452321222112212221.title: The King's Savior

14523212221122122212.content:
When you come to, you discover that your surroundings have changed. You are no longer in Renly's tent, nor are you on the ground. Instead, you are lying down on your own bed in your tent. You are securely under the covers.

Furthermore, you are not alone. Queen Margaery Tyrell is seated in a chair beside you. Two girls who are about her age are standing behind her.

"Your Grace," you acknowledge her presence, moving to sit up out of respect. However, Margaery stops you from rising.

"Don't get up," she urges you, "I would hate for you to overexert yourself."

You would hate that, too. As you settle back down, you ask "How long have I been unconscious?"

"Almost five days," Margaery informs you, "Much has happened in that time."

"Was there still a battle?" you ask nervously.

"Yes," the queen reveals, "Fortunately for everyone, it did not last very long. When Stannis's forces saw how hopelessly outnumbered they were, they were quick to capitulate. Most of them came over to our side. The rest fought to the bitter end, or surrendered when their commander was captured."

"So, Lord Stannis is in custody?" you assume.

"Indeed," Margaery replies, "Both him AND his Red Witch, who was responsible for what happened in Renly's tent."

"Then you know of that, too?" you inquire.

"Of course," says Margaery, "The thing that attacked you and my husband was a shadow assassin conjured by Melisandre. Its goal was to kill my husband, and it would not have stopped until it completed its goal, or something else stopped it first. On that note... Renly told me about how you saved him at great risk to yourself."

"I'm just glad I was able to stop that monster," you mutter.

"So am I," Margaery declares, smiling, "Renly and I are indebted to you. We could never properly thank you for what you did. But we found a way to begin. That is why I took charge of caring for you these last few days."

You are stunned. "Well, I thank you for your concern, Your Grace."

"You need not thank me," is all Margaery says in response. After a pause, she asks "Do you think you can sit up?"

"I suppose," you mutter. Margaery then leans over and helps you sit up. As your blankets fall off your torso, you realize your chest is bare. You hastily grab for them and exclaim "Why am I naked?"

Margaery chuckles at that and says "Well, we had to remove your tunic in order to treat your injury. Besides, you're not naked. Let me show you..."

She then takes your blankets and pulls them all the way down to your feet. Indeed, you are not fully naked. There is one article of clothing you are wearing.
14523212221122122212.title: Wake to the Queen and her girls

145232122211221222122.content:
You discover that the only thing you are currently wearing is a thick, fluffy, white cloth diaper, wrapped securely and tightly around your loins. You promptly go red in the face and move to grab the blankets, but Margaery prevents you from covering yourself.

"It's alright," she assures you calmly.

You are not convinced of that. You turn to the queen and ask "Why am I in a nappy?"

"You were out of commission for five days," one of the handmaids, who had been silent up until now, reminds you. She is tall with dark hair and pale skin.

The other handmaid nods and says "This was the only way we could handle your... expulsions." She is a little shorter, with sandy blonde hair and slightly tanner skin.

Both of them are beautiful. Not as beautiful as Margaery, but still enough to turn heads. At any rate, you are quite embarrassed to be in just a diaper in front of the three of them. Gazing down awkwardly, you mutter "And you two are...?"

"Oh, you don't know," Margaery remarks, "Brynden, permit me to introduce my handmaids: Mira Forrester of the North and Sera Durwell of the Reach. They have been helping me care for you."

"Well... thank you," you mumble softly, still unable to look any of the girls in the eye. They giggle at your embarrassment. Just then, another thought occurs to you. You look up at Margaery and ask "Just HOW have the three of you been caring for me?"

"To be precise, it was not just the three of us," Margaery tells you. She then turns to the front of the pavilion and calls out "He's awake!"

As you turn to the entrance, Lady Catelyn Stark and Lady Brienne of Tarth step inside. Now you are in front of five very beautiful woman in nothing but a diaper. You feel an overwhelming desire to crawl into a hole. Alas, you have nowhere to go.

Lady Catelyn sits down in a chair on the other side of the bed, and she says "I am glad to see you are well, Brynden."

"As am I," Lady Brienne comments, standing behind the Lady of Winterfell.

"Thank you both," you mumble quietly. "So... the five of you have been tending to me?"

"That is correct," Queen Margaery confirms, "To answer your earlier question, we have been feeding you, cleaning you, and changing you routinely. Any other questions?"

"How have you been cleaning me?" you ask.

The queen informs you "Mira, Sera, and I took wet washcloths and rubbed your body down twice a day. We also took the liberty of shaving all the hair off your body, except for what's on your head."

You gaze down at your body, and sure enough, there is not a single hair anywhere down there. Your toned arms, legs, and chest are totally smooth.

"What about feeding?" you ask.

For a while after the Mad King's death, the realm seemed a better place. However, the people of Westeros soon realized that while Robert Baratheon was an excellent leader of armies, his aptitude as a leader of the people left much to be desired. At least under the Targaryens' rule, there had been stability and security. Or so you had heard, anyway. You were only born a year or two before the rebellion began. A third is a girl with sandy blond hair, and she seems to be from the Free City of Lys. The fourth one - and only male - is a tall man with a thick bear and thinning hairline. All of them are standing around the desk, and they are either speaking to and tending to the fifth one, who is actually seated at the desk. "Well, I brought my horse, Aerion, with me," you reply, "But other than that, I came here with no one else."

She nods again. "Have your any family back in the Seven Kingdoms?"

You shake your head and reveal "Both my parents died before my seventh nameday. I have spent these last ten years traveling around Westeros, doing what I must in order to survive."

She seems a little saddened. "I understand how you must feel. I've no living family, either."

"Yes, I am aware," you mutter, trying to sound sympathetic, "I was born shortly after your brother Rhaegar, your father Aerys, and your mother Rhaella died. The whole of Westeros knows of the plight of you and your brother Viserys."

"Yes, and Viserys himself died recently," Daenerys glumly recalls, "It was my husband who killed him. Then my husband and my unborn son died not long after."

"How so, Your Grace?" you ask.

"I know nothing of Westeros," Daenerys explains, "I was born there, but immediately after my birth, I sailed east. The only other native of Westeros in my company is Ser Jorah Mormont, and he has not been to the Seven Kingdoms in many years. You, however, came from there how long ago?"

"I do, Your Grace," you insist, "I can tell you anything you would wish to know about it."

Daenerys looks pleased. "Then here is what I propose: if you swear fealty to me and help me reclaim my family's throne, you will be greatly compensated for your troubles and your services. Serve me faithfully, and you will never again have to struggle to find work or survive. How does that sound?"

You do not need long to think. You vigorously nod your head and declare "My sword is yours, Your Grace."

You extend your hand. It may be unorthodox for a commoner to bind a contract with a princess by a handshake, but you feel this type of contract would warrant such a gesture.

info.brief_description: Follow the story of a young man in Westeros who craves a mother's soothing caress.
info.description:
This is a story about a quiet, lonely, orphaned male POV character in Westeros who misses surrendering to the warm, affectionate bosom of a mother he never knew. Little does he know that his deepest, most secret wish is about to be fulfilled by some of the most significant women on the continent, who desire an unusually close relationship with their new son.

Rules

What is Forbidden:

1) Gruesome toilet related details. This does not mean that the main character cannot be babied or cannot be slightly embarrassed or humiliated by a loving mother, or cannot be placed in diapers, just do not go into excruciating detail about his soiling them in the event that he needs to be changed. Other than that, no toilet related content for any other character is allowed.
2) Vore and unbirth
3) Lesbian and gay interactions of any kind. There can be other male and female supporting characters in the narrative, but the main sexual interactions must be between the POV character and women only
4) Actual age regression. The POV will remain mentally, physically, and sexually an adult, even if he is treated as a baby or young child
5) Transformation/Transgender/Growth/Shrinkage
6) Overeating/Obesity


What is Encouraged

1) Breastfeeding and Lactation
2) Sex (Blowjobs, Handjobs, Titjobs, etc)
3) Pampering, Kissing, Fondling, etc
4) Tickling and blowing raspberries
5) Spanking
6) Mild Mother-Son Dominance (for actual Femdom please see my other story)
7) Multiple mothers/aunts/sisters etc.
8) POV character being kidnapped/otherwise forced into it


Please make sure to avoid poor grammar, usage, mechanics, spelling, sentence structure, punctuation, etc. In other words, please put some effort and creativity into your writing. I will not allow sloppily written chapters to remain. Also, while creativity and detail are highly encouraged, please make sure you keep the characters and setting of the original TV show/books intact. If you are unfamiliar with the source material and require help, please contact me. Similarly, if you have any doubts about whether what you intend to write is forbidden, please contact me.

I will give gift points to anyone who writes chapters that are creative, descriptive, and fulfill the above criteria. For exact rates, please contact me. Note: I will not give gift points for lazily written work. I'm not demanding perfection, but I do demand excellence.
